Reviews.Title: “Great views, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: EliseNY
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. The views were great from our room. Found the location convenient and cabs were easy to get about two blocks away. Take the hotel card with the location/map on it that they provide with you, it was very useful for the cab drivers we had.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Cat L
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff, large and nicely furnished rooms, close to cafÃ©s and restaurants, not far from historic sites

Reviews.Title: “perfect city escape”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkDesign
Reviews.Content: amazing service, very tasteful design, excellent breakfast, great Cihangir location.

Reviews.Title: “A Must Stay in Istanbul...”
Reviews.Author: BostonFemme
Reviews.Content: I decided to celebrate my 40th b-day with a few girlfriends in Istanbul and chose this hotel based on the rave reviews on Trip Advisor. These reviews were RIGHT ON! LOCATION: In a cute neighborhood within walking distance to Beyoglu and Taksim Square, and you can even walk over to Eminonou (where you get the ferry and location of the Spice Market), Sirkeci and Sultanahmet on a nice day. Ortakoy was about a 30 min cab ride away (went to dinner at Chillai Restaurant and Reina Nightclub), but was not a bad ride. The surrounding area of the hotel has very cozy, bohemian type restaurants/cafes. ACCOMMODATIONS: Excellent. We stayed in a corner Grand King Suite, and although it was on the first floor, we had an amazing view of the city. The suite was about 530 square feet, very large by hotel standards! The bed was a standard size King bed, and very comfortable! The kitchenette was awesome - fridge, microwave, coffee machine, glasses and flatware. Bathroom was amazing - had an adjustable shower head on the wall and several shower heads on the ceiling for an unbelievable shower experience. Wonderful Molton Brown body wash, shampoo, conditioner, hand soap, hand lotion and body cream. This room was truly our home away from home. SERVICE: Even in advance of our stay the hotel gave us amazing service. Arranging for car service to and from the airport made things so easy. Arranging a trusted private tour guide for us as well (which, by the way, is the only way to go if you want to hit as many landmarks as possible in a day, and they show you the great local restaurants/cafes as well as get you appointments at the best Turkish Bath House in Istanbul :)). We were warmly greeted by the staff upon arrival and a welcome drink and snacks were brought up to our suite. Breakfast each morning was fresh and delicious, and you could either have it in the lounge or order and have it brought up to your room for no extra charge. Most hotels nickel and dime you for everything - this hotel does not. I had mentioned to the front desk staff in passing that it was my birthday, and sure enough when we returned from our day tour, there was a beautiful birthday cake in our suite (that said happy birthday with my name spelled correctly which is huge since most people get the spelling of my name wrong) compliments of the hotel! We were there Easter weekend and they also placed delicious Easter cookies on our pillow. They were so incredibly helpful in arranging all our cab transportation and making our dinner reservations. Really, anything you wanted they would bend over backwards for you. Four Seasons service at a bargain price!!! I love, love, love this hotel and would not hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Michelle A
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a gem of a find! I am so pleased we stayed here. The rooms have a little kitchenette and living room area, which is lovely. The shower is amazing! It was such a nice retreat from the craziness that is Istanbul. The location is quite good, its in an area close to the main street Istiklal Caddessi, about a 10 minute walk (up hill), there is a tram stop not too far away, probably a 10 min walk also (downhill), the streets leading to the tram stop are a little treacherous though! Very steep and the road/footpaths are not at all maintained, obviously not the fault of the hotel, but I wouldn't want to be injured or elderly and have to walk up or down that hill very often! I cannot not comment enough how brilliant the rooms and service is in this boutique hotel. The breakfast which is included in the room rate is fine, nothing to write home about, but its tasty enough and has enough variety.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid view!”
Reviews.Author: Swissness70
Reviews.Content: Make sure that you book a room with panoramic-view - it is absolutely worth it! My room was on the sixt floor. The room was very comfortable and the bathroom clean and functional. Rooms on sixt floor offers also a lovely terrace with two chairs and a table. The neighbourhood is quite (except for the prayers call (Adhan) which starts already at 5:30 AM) and also very safe. The hotel is perfectly well located, everything is in walking distance. The hotel offers a small breakfast-buffet. The staff is very friendly and attentive. The only negativ remark concerns the air-conditioning which did not work at all and also I am not really sure if the stated 40sqm are really stretch the truth. Anway I was really content with Witt Istanbul Suites and can recommend this hotel without any doubt!

Reviews.Title: “amazing !”
Reviews.Author: NIKOLAIDOU
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect place to stay in Istanbul. Excellant. Beatiful view, the best saff. Everyone was very polite. They reception staff gave us the bes tips where to go what to do. Design, breakfast, rooms no words to say. Congratlation to the owners and the staff. In Witt Istanbul you feel protective like nothing bad can possibly happened to you. Nice library at the lobby, nice bathroom. he view from the terrace is a must. The service as quick and the quality of the amenitiesat the bathroom excellant. Witt Istanbul suites is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Marina_Serdarevic
Reviews.Content: My husband and me spent four days at this wonderful hotel and found it to be great place for a city break. The hotel is only 10 mins to main square and easy walking distance of many attractions and historic sites. The stuff was very friendly and helpful, spoke excellent English and very willing to assist with recommendations for restaurants and clubs. Room on the top floor was magnificent with a beautiful view over Istanbul. We will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Mindblowing!”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey S
Reviews.Content: Exceptionally talented and helpful staff (all of them) running the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in. From collecting us from the cruise port to dropping us off at the airport, they constantly surprised us with their organisation and generosity. The hotel lobby is a masterclass in urban chic, with cool music wafting through an airy marbled space, welcoming and funky. The rooms are to die for, especially the 6th floor ones with views across the Bosphorous and Istanbul's old section. Minimalist designer decor and very modern facilities make the stay special and memorable. We'll be back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jfletcher
Reviews.Content: I can only repeat and amplify the many complimentary reviews for this establishment. The staff were incredibly helpful during our 6 night stay. We had room 42 for 4 nights, but, as the legendary room 61 was available for 2 nights during our stay, we took the option to upgrade. Room 42 has an excellent view over Istanbul and the Golden Horn, room 61 has the same view from two floors higher up, but with the big plus that it has a large terrace. The only minor criticism I have is that the website reservation process does not provide a room-by-room description of the facilities and view for each apartment, and the option to select which one you want. The use of terms like 'Grand King' and 'Grand Queen Panoramic' is not helpful. There are only 17 rooms so this shouldn't be too much to ask. For anyone interested in staying at Witt suites I would strongly recommend that you phone them first to discuss your requirements and book the specific room that you want.

Reviews.Title: “first time in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: frankman_10_12
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife spent four nights at the Witt Istanbul. There are quite a few well designed hotels in Istanbul, but hardly any at such a central, well connected yet quiet location. We had a very spacious room on the third floor (there were only three rooms on this level). The staff does speak English and was extremely friendly and helpful. Since the Witt is a boutique hotel, you know all the staff after your second night. There is an open, but cozy breakfast area on the lobby level, and the included breakfast offers the whole variety from sweet to healthy or hearty. If one prefers to sit outside and enjoy the busy street life, there are many places in the same street where you can have breakfast, lunch or dinner. The only improvement I would suggest is to install better lights in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: panda58
Reviews.Content: Cozy boutique hotel in Beyoglu, in the midst of Istanbul. Location quite close to tram with easy connection to Old town. Lobby is also breakfast area, comfortable, quiet and intimate feel. Breakfast service is nice with omelette,eggs to order, fresh orange juice and coffee to choose. Reception and concierge service is good and welcoming. Wifi in lobby and room fine. Small hotel without fitness, but as a tourist not a problem. We had room 63, on the 6th floor, a queen bed room with private terrace and a nice view of town and galata tower. Only point of warning:room is on website described as 40 square meter, but this is including the 10 m terrace, rendering the actual room somewhat smallish for people who are paying 290 euro per night. The other rooms on 6 th floor have magnificent views and much larger, but also a lot more expensive. Very nice for tourists on a romantic city trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Elegant Istanbul Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: biglurk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a great trip to Turkey - we had last been there as students in 1972! We stayed at the Witt for the first four days of the trip, and for the last three. We drove to Troy, Gallipoli, Bergama and Izmir during the rest of the stay. The Witt was wonderful. We had room 52 for both stays, and the view of the Bosphorus was spectacular. The suite is spacious and well decorated. I could sing sonnets about the shower - best, ever, anywhere! The entire staff is fabulous and breakfast is awesome. This is a quiet haven in a very hustle bustle city. Don't miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mashaman
Reviews.Content: Lovely stylish boutique property in a great location. The walk up and down the hill is steep, but the staff, rooms and food make it more than worthwhile. We were lucky enough to be on a higher floor, so we had sweeping views of the city. Also, try Hayat. The hotel sent us there and it was the best meal we had on the trip! Love the Witt!

Reviews.Title: “superb class of elegance, comfort and service”
Reviews.Author: isabel p
Reviews.Content: The Witt is one of the best hotels we stayed in worldwide. Calm, great service and attention, excellent breakfast, perfect location in trendy and cosy neighbourhood, stylish rooms, in one word: outstanding class. If we make it back to Istanbul, it will surely bring us back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and location”
Reviews.Author: Graham l
Reviews.Content: I could go on and on about how beautiful the rooms are, the stunning breakfast, perfect location .It is an excellent choice for tourist visitors to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Mitja S
Reviews.Content: Staff was very nice and helpful. Room was clean, stylish and spacious with little kitchen. Alley under our room was very quiet, so we got good sleeps. Hotel is on walking distance TO center, but maybe not when coming back after full day of walking. Breakfast was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, great view”
Reviews.Author: Stranger101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Witt hotel after a few days in Sultanahmet doing the touristic highlights and though we loved that too, arriving at Witt was like a breath of fresh air. The hotel is located in a nice, quiet and upcoming neighborhood and actually encourages one to explore more of Istanbul. The entire hotel breaths a contemporary style that you either like or not. We did. Very much so. One can't get enough of the views from the fifth and sixth floors we were on. Just sit on your couch or bed, have a drink and watch the endless stream of ferries mooring and departing in the Golden Horn. Very friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast is being served in the lobby and provides for a great start of the day. Honestly, how much of these extensive and expensive breakfast buffets in your typical 5-star hotel do you really use anyway..? Too bad it was only for one night... Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service. Superb Views. Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: AOA68
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights in Suite 61 (6th/top floor), which had a fabulous terrace that overlooked both the local neighbourhood as well as the Bosporus. The discount I was given for the King Suite with Terrace was too good to miss out on. The hotel is just the right size; neither big and impersonal nor small and casual. Just the right size to feel at home, but with professional services available around the clock. Aytuk and the fabulous hotel staff provided a great service, were constantly at hand to give directions and suggestions and made our stay a wonderful treat. The suite itself was perfect, and the facilities just right. The Nespresso coffee Machine was an excellent addition and the bed was very very comfortable. The free Internet (excellent connection) was a very big plus, but the biggest draw had to be the view. I simply couldn't get enough of it; day or night. If there were some drawbacks, and one would be knit-picking; it would be the steep climb to the hotel and the uphill, although less steep walk to Taksim (the walk back from Taksim is a breeze). One could of course take a taxi, but since the distances were quite short, I felt embarrassed to take a taxi and preferred the huff and puff of the short but tough climb. I must stress, it was my decision not to take a taxi up the hill when I could have, and the hotel could not be faulted for it. Also, while the breakfast setting was very very nice and the service first class; a little bit more variety in the items from day to day would have been nice. The ride up the lift always had me laugh; make sure to take the lift from the basement all the way to the 6th floor at least once during your stay. I didn't get to use the spa facilities, but a couple I chatted with at breakfast spoke very highly of the them. Thank you Aytuk, Anil and all those at Witt. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel on a quiet street”
Reviews.Author: Hivedoc
Reviews.Content: The Witt Hotel is very small and personal. Each floor has three or four large, very modern suites. Mine had a great bathroom with rain shower. A large bar-kitchen area off the bedroom, and a balcony from which I would sip a cocktail while listening to the call to prayer echo over Istanbul. The hotel is at the top of a very steep hill and a 10 minute walk from Istiklal pedestrian street which is thriving and full of shops and eating. Walking on the hotels street from Istiklal feels safe even late at night. It is every bit of a 20 minute walk to make the bridge crossing into the old section of Istanbul with the Grand Bizarre and most famous mosques. The hotel's street is quiet and primarily residential. The staff at the Witt are fantastic. Multi-lingual, very friendly, and go out of their way to help. Breakfasts are simple and have turkish baked goods, cheeses and nice fruits. The bar area is nice for a cocktail after a long sweaty day in busy Istanbul. Please note that cab drivers in Turkey speak little English and have no idea where the Witt is as it is not a large place. Bring the address and phone number. You also can arrange transportation from the airport via the hotel. I had them arrange transportation from the hotel to the airport for an early flight and it was flawless.

Reviews.Title: “An unbeatable view”
Reviews.Author: journeyjane
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great trip to Istanbul. We were enthusiastically greeted at the Witt with an upgrade to room 62 thus making a great start straightaway to our holiday. The room itself was lovely, spacious and we were delighted with an amazing view across the Golden Horn spanning the Topkapi Palace, the Hagia Sofia, the Blue mosque and the Galata Tower. These silhouettes were made even more spectacular when lit up at night like golden nuggets - it was hard going to sleep at night and taking our eyes off this beautiful sight; given that we are very well travelled people and have seen many gorgeous sights, this is saying a lot. The staff were always pleasant and helpful, particularly Volkan and Aygut. The hotel location is close to lots of eateries- go to Comsufirin for coffee and biscuits; off Istiklal street - go to Zubeyir Ocakbasi for delicious grills; also nearby are antique shops on the cool Cukurcuma district; the tram was quick to get to, cheap, and took us to Sultanahmet, where the main sites and bazaars are, within minutes. The added Muezzin call lent great atmosphere to an already wonderful holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: JGJ_L_BE
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend in Feb 12. Hotel is perfect, got an upgrade to room 61, corner suite on top floor, which has fantastic views over the city. Location is great, we went everywhere on foot, major sights within walking distance. Excellent breakfast and staff is very friendly and helpful. Nothing but praise for this hotel, perfect, loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and Lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: briony t
Reviews.Content: I have to say I've never experienced service like this. Loved the staff at the Witt - they are totally helpful and informative. The hotel is great. The steep hill that everyone goes on about is fine and good exercise for one's bottom! Large rooms - very comfortable. No baths which was a bit sad (just showers) but this was not the end of the world. Well situated. Just B&B but staff really helpful about which restaurants to visit both in the immediate area and Istanbul at large. Really had a great time. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: roamers46
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel to end our 3 week tour of Turkey. We had already had 3 days in Sultanahmet at the beginning of our trip and decided that Beyoglu would give us anouther dimension of Istanbul. Furthermore we wanted something hip and luxe. Witt suites met all the criteria. Our suite was on the 5th floor and despite it being a city view room we could see the Bosphorus to the Galata Tower. The room was spaciuos and well fitted out. The breakfast scrumptious and relaxed. You really do feel priviledged staying here. One night we decided to eat in and use our kitchenette facilities and this allowed us to just relax after a busy day in Nisantasi. We visited Dolmabahce Palace...Easy walking distance and very interesting. Taksim easy walking distance. Cihangir where the Hotel is situated has small supermarkets and cafes worth trying....just walk up the hill towards Taksim. The hotel sent welcoming emails on our reservation and helpful itineraries. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “WOOOWWW!!”
Reviews.Author: rosner
Reviews.Content: We have travelled a lot over the last years and we have stayed in quite some beautiful hotels all over the world. When it came to choosing a hotel in Istanbul, our choice was quickly made (thanks to the great reviews here on Tripadvisor). So what can we say about the Witt Istanbul Suites? GORGEOUS! The rooms are very large, beautifully and tastfully decorated and we straightaway felt like our stay was going to be one of a kind. We stayed in room NÂ°53 on the 5th floor. This room seems to have a very good price/quality ration. Room NÂ°52 is even nicer (the view is even more interesting) but more expensive too. So if you need to choose for a hotel in Istanbul and you want to get away from large chains like Hilton etc., make sure to stay at the Witt Istanbul. But all design etc by side, we have NEVER had staff as pleasant as at the Witt Istanbul. We don't remember all their names, but every single one of them was always willing to go out of their way to help us...hospitality at its best!!! We want to especially point out how pleasant Ali, Anil and Volcan were. Thanks for making our stay so pleasant!!

Reviews.Title: “stay at witt and email me if you dont like it. (i am from istanbul)”
Reviews.Author: morisabravaya
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at most of the 5 star hotels in the city. Witt's location is great: it is close to the old town, at the heart of the galleries and museums and 5 minutes by car to the night life. So more or less everything that I am looking for since restaurants are scattered all around the city. (but try Maya that is a walking distance) The decoration is great (autoban design. no more words needed. why? check their website or fly business with turkish airlines. they designed the vip loungeas well) I guess the rooms are spacious (we stayed in a 50m2 room). 2 more details: I reserved a room, the hotel was not busy, so I got an upgrade. I asked for a late check out, our room was free for the next day, and they offered a late check-out at 15:00. If I had a hotel, thats exactly what I would do. Great stay, great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: SNL2011
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel by accident - but what a happy accident! It's in a great location - only 15 minutes from Taksim Square. There are many cafes nearby and the street it not too busy. The hotel is very modern and new, which is different from the other hotels in this area. I was pleasantly surprised by the standard room - it was so big! Not only does it have a comfy queen sized bed, but a sitting area and bar! And the shower had 6 amazing showerheads! We loved how the hotel and rooms were decorated. The staff were always very helpful and kind too. The buffet was in the bar lobby, which again, was very nicely decorated. There was a good selection for breakfast and the coffee and tea were fantastic. Overall, we would highly recommend this hotel to anyone! It's a bit pricey, but totally worth it. A bonus for us: they had a 3-for-2 night special! Check out their website for specials, or ask the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great area”
Reviews.Author: stiletravel
Reviews.Content: Witt Istanbul might be a little bit expensive (for Istanbul) but it is a great hotel with exceptional friendly and helpful staff and in a great "local" area. The rooms were very stylish, large, very clean and with simple kitchen facilities. What would make this hotel perfect ? Noise (from both inside and outside the hotel) is a bit annoying - sound proofing isn't great. There is a good TV in the room but you can not see it from the bed. The hotel does not have a cafe or in room dinning (apart from breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul = Witt”
Reviews.Author: Alya S
Reviews.Content: Excellent stuff and service, real support in all needs up to airport pickup and perfect restaurants booking at "busy" weekend nights. Lovely interiors and amazing breakfast-to-room service. will come back again! For romantic holidays there is no a better place. Although location is a bit "hidden", it gives you feeling of real staying and ancient and very sophisticated suit. For couples it's best place to stay in. Istanbul = Witt!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, location, cleanliness and price”
Reviews.Author: AlfonsoIII
Reviews.Content: Great location in new Istanbul. Extremely comfortable and clean rooms. The only drawback is walking up a hill to arrive to the hotel. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home, amazing staff, a excellent choice all round.”
Reviews.Author: tilleyma
Reviews.Content: I booked the Witt Istanbul Suites having already booked into the W Istanbul and changing my mind.... I'm so glad I did!! This place is everything you hope for when visiting a city for the first time. The material stuff first... The rooms are big, clean, airy, have excellent kitchen facilities and awesome shower. The fittings are high quality, nothing was broken and the design features add to the quality feel of the place. The personal stuff... The thing that really sets this place apart from the other high end choices in Istanbul is the staff... They are knowledgable, courteous, ever obliging no matter what the request; I would say some of the best service I've ever had. Never intrusive but when called upon for recommendations or advice they were spot on following a series of questions to hone in on exactly what we were looking for. The final pleasant surprise was the final bill, we happily munched on nuts, coffees and even alcoholic drinks in the lobby and from the mini from time to time and having picked up bills in bars around the city thought they would be a similar cost... Not the case. They were very reasonably priced which I wish I'd known sooner as we'd have stopped for drinks more! The location is good for those who like to walk to the main sights (or use the excellent transport links), myself and my partner didn't use the tram once... Istanbul is hilly and the hotel itself is located half way up a incline, bring sensible shoes! We easily walked across to Sultanahemet in 30 mins, stopping off for the recommend per Baklava enroute for fuel! The location is perfect for exploring antique shops, restaurants and bars that are all on its doorstep. All round a fantastic experience... Highly recommended to all who want a fantastic base to chill out, relax and feel at home and be given pearled wisdom on what to do in this incredible city.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Claire W
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night at the Witt after having a few days on the Princes Islands but it was a complete treat. After climbing the very steep hill from Tophane it was like arriving in an oasis of calm. The front of house staff were so welcoming and knowlegeable about the area and the room was divine. A large suite with DVD, music player, a glorious bathroom and kitchen area in the distinctive Witt design. Breakfast in the lobby was delicious and prepared to order and the local recommendation for dinner was equally lovely. We would recommend it unreservedly and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Compare”
Reviews.Author: Kevin_Isbell
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weeks stay at The Witt and was one of the best hotel experiences in recent memory. The staff is attentive without being intrusive, the rooms spacious and well appointed. The location, in Cihangir, was perfect for me. Far removed from the chaos of Sultanhamet, yet close enough to all that Beyoglu has to offer. A true getaway.

Reviews.Title: “perfect experience all around”
Reviews.Author: beafoulger
Reviews.Content: my husband and i fell in love with this hotel the moment we walked in to see the smiling staff and then were taking to our stunning room! the glowing reviews are all true, this place is a gem of a hotel in a fabulous neighborhood. the rooms was beautiful, great comfy king bed, spacious and well designed shower/bathroom that i want to copy in my own home, and a great little kitchen/bar area. ample storage and living space. beautifiul views. the feel is very luxe but also very comfortable. The breakfast buffet is also excellent, lots of variety and very fresh and healthy. we ate something different every day. Not that we spent that much time in our rooms, this hotel is a great jumping off point for exploring the windy cobblestone streets, sites, and architecture that is istanbul. the hotel was super helpful with recommendations in the 'hood and beyond (Hayat- DO NOT miss it! you must eat here! Journey- super chill w/great food) and also very patient in helping us learn and practice our pronunciation on few turkish phrases we reallty wanted to master! We spent at least 30 minutes most evenings talking the ears off the hotel staff after we returned from dinner, drinking a Cay (me) and Raki (husband) and learning about the area and the city, all of the guys have great insights and recommendations about the city, invaluble information when you only have a few days to explore a city the size of istanbul just a note for other gym rats like us- this hotel doesnt have a gym and although walking around istanbul is pretty great excersice in itself, my husband and i went to the Cihangir Sports Center twice during our 4 day sta. The sports center is clean and welcoming, its 15 lira for a day pass, and just a 2 minute walk from the hotel. The entrance looks residential, it is right next to the parking garage entrance by the supermarket across from Akbank! yes, the hill up from tophane is very steep, but this is istanbul- thats why the views are so amazing! also, you'll be in good company on the walk up and will likely will get beaten up the hill by a local granny, mom with 2 kids in tow or an elderly gentleman with a cane, all of which happened to us, to our great amusement to everyone at the Witt, we cant wait to see you all again soon, thank you for making our trip just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, Swanky rooms & charming details”
Reviews.Author: Theoden61
Reviews.Content: My vacation in Turkey ended in Istanbul at the Witt Istanbul Suite. What a great way to round up a most pleasant holiday. The modern & tasteful decor welcomes the traveller as on steps through the door. Travel guides, novels and books on designs lined book shelves in the lounge area. That to me is most inviting indeed. A Mac sits next to the books...another plus to the management. Enough has been said about the comfortable and well-appointed rooms. I really love the rain showers and the Molten Brown soap and shampoo! And of course one must not forget the heated bathroom floor. What thoughtfulness. But the star attraction really is the friendly staff. They are genuinely interested in serving you and go out of their way to meet your needs. The young men all speak good English and has the patience of saints! The number of questions we asked them and the requests we make were all cheerfully met. I have nothing but good to say of this hotel. Well done...and yes, get into the elevator and meet Mr. Wit...all the way to the 6th floor. He is most long suffering and charming! He will attend to you 24/7!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, a pearl!”
Reviews.Author: Natus_1
Reviews.Content: The following things have made our stay in the Witt Istanbul Hotel unforgettable: The location: A short stroll uphill leads to the Taksim Sqare, wheras a short walk downhill from the hotel the "Tophane" tram stop is located. From there the most famous sights of Istanbul can easily be reached. At the same time, the hotel is located in a very quiet and authentic quarter of Istanbul, which provides very good opportunities for having dinner. The guest rooms: First of all, the huge size of the hotel rooms (approximately 50 square meters), which is untypical for city hotels, has to be mentioned. Furthermore, the furnishing is very stylish and of high quality (the fotos on the web presence of the hotels are genuine!). We really enjoyed spending time in the hotel rooms. The service: The whole hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The concierge gives useful information and very good tipps. Additional information: - Nice breakfast buffet featuring turkish specialities. Note that the size of the buffet is adjusted to the the small amount of guest rooms. - Easy and free wireless access - TV with mostly turkish channels, but a DVD player

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Human K
Reviews.Content: very friendly staff; located very nice and close to tram also; I liked the hotel very much and the interior also.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a stylish mini-break”
Reviews.Author: capabilitybarnes
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 3 night stay at the Witt. We were given room 42 which was a corner room with a great view of the Bosphorus and the domes and minarets of the skyline of old-istanbul. The room was great, huge and very design-led. We loved the stylish shower room, generous molton brown products and the enormous bed! We had room-service breakfast every morning too, which was really beautifully presented, at no extra charge. The service was fabulous too - the front desk run a proper concierge services for you, and everything was seamless. For us, the location was great. The hotel is in an up-and-coming area of Istanbul full of junk/retro antiques shops, art galleries and cafes etc. We also found we could walk to dinner every evening as there were lots of cool restaurants and bars within 10/15 mins walk (allbeit up a few hills!) So many hotels claim to be boutique but fall down on the concept, service or little extras that really make a place bespoke. The Witt pulls it off - highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “The Crossroads of Civilizations”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoHappyGirl
Reviews.Content: The Witt is a spectacular, quite corner of Istanbul that graciously and effortlessly welcomes her guests and sees to every detail with a nuanced and careful eye. From the sophisticated and elegant lobby, the welcome from a staff of professional, to the suite's careful appointments. The location is IDEAL. A quick walk to Taxim Square and an equally lovely walk to Galata Bridge connecting the Occident with the Orient. Recommendations on food, museums, anything were spot on. Spend a week and look forward to staying again. Soon, I hope.

Reviews.Title: “elegant accommodation in a central location”
Reviews.Author: diecicolli
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3-day stay at the Witt and have nothing but superlativs to describe the experience. The Witt offers elegant accommodations in its spacious suites along with first-rate service by a competent and friendly staff. The top floors offer fabulous views of the old city and the Bosporus. The location in the up-and-coming Cihangir area is off the beaten tourist path and offers a glimpse of refined local life. The Witt is just up the hill from the wonderful Istanbul Modern art museum and the Karakoy area with its rich offering of private art galleries. It is just down hill from Taksim square and Istiklal Caddesi, the heart of shopping and eating districts.

Reviews.Title: “A funky, friendly respite”
Reviews.Author: kbhenrikson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Witt Istanbul Suites at the beginning of our travels along the coast and islands of Turkey and Greece. We weren't sure what to expect, had never travelled to Turkey before, and we found the hotel staff and rooms to be excellent. Everything was well taken care of, very modern, welcoming, and it was an enormous help to us that the staff spoke English. The room came with a mini kitchen, just enough to make some tea or coffee and prep some things you might have ordered in from room service (breakfast is great, so much food!). The location is such that you are not in the middle of the major tourist spots in the Golden Horn area, but you can certainly take the tram or even walk across the bridge to them. The hotel is set on quite a steep hill, so if you plan to walk most places or are driving and need to park the car, be aware of this. It is close to the modern art museum, great spot to check out. I'd certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “cozy place where you want to spend some time”
Reviews.Author: EdanaSchul
Reviews.Content: Witt ticks all the boxes of the perfect boutique hotel. Located in an area frequented by the locals, the Witt takes you away from the touristy hussle and bustle which we dont like and immerses you in a part of real Istanbul, where people that work there live and go about their lives. Walking distance from main shopping streets, some great restaurants and taksim square. Also a quick taxi ride to most tourist attractions. Having travelled in winter the lounge was very welcoming on arrival, as was our room. the design details are beautiful and i appreciated many aspects of the room. one thing thats good about the witt suites is that the kitchen is actually something they encourage you to use. go to the market and buy some of the amazing fresh ingredients they have and cook something in your suite. We didn't have time unfortunately. We unfortunately didnt have a good view from our room - room 11. But I think if you have a room on the higher floors that would be different. You can also order takeaway to the hotel room - which the staff happily do for you (and deliver it to your room!) - we did this the night we arrived and it was such a nice way to experience some traditional food - in our new home for 4 days! the staff are very helpful and made various restaurant bookings for us - they also advised on taxis and travel time and we called them for assistance on arrival at the airport. Breakfast was lovely - whether you have it in your room or the lobby area. all in all a great escape for a long weekend with fantastic hospitality, personal service and a gorgeous place to spend some time out of the cold. I think if we travel to Istanbul again i will check out the penthouse suite - which looks amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel and the wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: anntamura5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Witt from Oct 27-Nov 1, 2011. We were in suite 52 and had fantastic views of the Bosphorus and many of the mosques. The room was large, gorgeous, clean, and very comfortable. Relaxing in the cosy bar area after the 20 travel hours was a joy. Breakfast was wonderful. The staff was fantastic! Everyone was helpful, polite, and professional...impeccable. The hotel is walking distance to Istiklal Street, Taksim Square, the street cars, and many nice restaurants. I wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about it”
Reviews.Author: schnauzernyc
Reviews.Content: There's a reason i love staying in boutique hotels: the charm, design, attention to detail and impeccable service. all of these apply to the Witt. The rooms were lovely, shower amazing, breakfast delicious...there was simply nothing i didn't like about it. Bathrooms have nice Molton Brown products--a plus! The suite had a snazzy kitchenette complete with spacious mini-fridge, microwave, plates, glassware and cutlery. Location is good...I'm not enough of an expert on Istanbul but it's in the "new town" side of the bosphorus so not in the vicinity of the main attractions like the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, etc. but i actually preferred being away from the hustle of the touristy area. Instead, a short 3 minute walk down a hill brings to directly to the Tophane tram stop, and from there it's a short 10-15 minute above-ground ride to the old city. It's also down this same hill that brings you to the Istanbul Modern, whose restaurant i had wanted to try but just ran out of time. In all, one of the loveliest properties I've visited!

Reviews.Title: “Service of a very high standard !!”
Reviews.Author: carlos501b
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself stayed at the Witt for 7 nights from 6th November to 13th November, 2011. We were in suite 62 on the top floor and had fantastic views of the Bosphorus, the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Golden Horn, Galata Tower, etc, etc, etc. We paid 258 Euro per night. Turkish breakfast was included. It comprised eggs made any which way, sausages, coffee/tea, orange juice, fruits, cheeses, yogurt, figs, honey, walnuts, almonds, raisins, different types of breads, jams, etc, etc, etc. Turkish food is fantastic and we always made sure we could eat both lunch and dinner after the substantial breakfast in the morning. Both of us put on weight during our stay in Turkey :-) The front desk was manned by Aykut, Anil, Ali and Volcan while we were there. All four of them were outstanding. They went out of their way to help us. We found the hospitality in Turkey to be excellent overall. We avoided the steep hills in both directions by taking taxis, which are fairly reasonably priced. The Istiklal Caddesi area is a "must" visit area for its shops, cafes, restaurants, etc, etc, etc. Around the hotel is the Cihangir area which is filled with small grocery shops, cafes, restaurants, art galleries, boutiques, etc, etc. All in all, Witt was an excellent choice, for our first visit to Istanbul. The two things that really stood out were the fantastic view from our suite 62 and the excellent service of all the staff. We strongly recommend Witt, Istanbul and if we visit Istanbul again we will probably stay there again. Cheers, Carlos.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Istanbul accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth G
Reviews.Content: Attractive well located suites, very comfortable and clean, excellent helpful staff and excellent breakfast. Short walk to the tram though it is up a steep hill on the way back. Short journey to all the sites. Well located for good restaurants and bars. An area that is being gentrified. Thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Istanbul experience”
Reviews.Author: Marshman76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and wish we could have done for a lot longer. Great place, superb service and amazing location. Cihangir is very central and near to the old town, the lively Taksim Square area but better than that has many hidden interesting bars, restaurants and shops. No comments about the hotel apart from we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfection”
Reviews.Author: VincentDeWaele
Reviews.Content: Difficult to suggest any improvement: people are extremely kind, I loved the design of the hotel, not only the lounge but the room, the room are huge, good location, excellent service, etc. etc. So, save your timen no need to look for another place in Istanbul ...

Reviews.Title: “Witt Lived up to its High Billing”
Reviews.Author: JudithMarch2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Witt for three nights. I chose the Witt based on Tripadvisor ratings and an article in the Globe & Mail newspaper. They were certainly correct. The hotel is stylish, comfortable and well located in Cihanger, an area becoming gentrified. The staff couldn't have been more helpful particularly Ali who always seemed to be at the front desk when we arrived with questions. He made excellent restaurant recommendations. The Witt is a good place to stay if you are tired of the tourist crush in the Sultanahmet and want to see a different side of Istanbul. The rooms are well equipped with a small kitchen, living space with large TV, free WiFi and an edgy design which was fun. I would definitely stay here again. The only niggle was the heat on our last night. Apparently, at the end of October the management deems it winter and shuts off the air conditioning. The only way to cool our room was to leave the windows open which made it noisy with the street traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Outrageously great”
Reviews.Author: Edwers
Reviews.Content: I rate the Witt 5 stars as I believe the hotel is one of the best I have stayed in. The hotel is in the Cihanger area which is becoming hip and desirable; unfortunately, it is one of the hillier areas of the city. The walk up from the tram is incredible; although, many (even those in my age category) did not find it terrible, one has to consider this in your decision. It could literally be a heartbreaker. Of course, there are always taxis and the staff will tell you the approximate fare. The hotel will give you an instruction card to show a driver for the return trip. If this is your first time in Istanbul you may want to stay in the Sultanahmet area. Since this was our 3rd time in the city, we opted for a different location. But on to the really good things. The hotel is very new and small (18 rooms). The design is modern and intriguing. Our room had 4 floor to ceiling windows with a king-size bed, large closet, a white marble kitchen area (microwave, coffee maker, hot water kettle), sofa, rocking chair, large screen TV, bathroom with a multiple-head shower. The hardwood floor added to the contemporary look. The room was very clean; a fresh feel. The free WIFI never failed us. The staff is young, professional and untiring. They are the heart of the organization. They serve breakfast in the lobby dining area, drinks in the afternoon and are constantly tidying all the public areas. The concierge/desk people are extraordinarily helpful and move at lightening speed to help. We stayed here for 4 nights and would do so again; however, before selecting this venue think about the hill (you may have to walk it once or twice). You will never forget the place or the hill....believe me!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Henley on Thames, null, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: Anthony L
Reviews.Content: Very spacious and comfortable room. Staff very helpful and friendly. Excellent location for sightseeing and for the cruise departure terminal. I used their airport transfer service - very comfortable and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “remarkable experience in this price segment”
Reviews.Author: fruechardt
Reviews.Content: This small hotel in excellent location of lively Istanbul between Taksim square and Galata Bridge is one of the best hotel experiences that I had in my life. The hotel is built in modern design and stlye that give me ideas for my personal dream architecture house. The rooms are spacy and clean and very comfortable. The team who runs the hotel does it with passion, they really mean to be as friendly and perfect as they are. The one thing that they can do better is to prepare sunny side up fried eggs where the white isnt runny. But we just ordered omlette the second day and that was perfect. Remember bringing Nespresso coffe capsules when stayinf there. In the room they charge Eur 3 for each. Our room had a great view, floor heating in the bathroom, rain-shower, bar, very spacy, .....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Leanne M
Reviews.Content: Witt Istanbul is a stylish hotel with super friendly staff - free wifi and stunning breakfast and possibly anything else you would need! Ignore other reviews that say it's too far from the sightseeing - we found it to be the perfect location. Short walk to Tophane tram stop and within minutes you're across the Galata bridge to the Archaeological museum/Topkapi....then after a fabulous day of being blown away by thousands of years of history, you can return to the Witt away from the busy tourist areas and go for a delightful evening stroll with the locals along Istiklal Cadessi, drink at one of the many fab bars and eat at one of the many excellent restaurants. There are many streets to explore in this area to provide a modern view of Istanbul, lots of cool/eclectic design and furniture stores to stumble across.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Seb S
Reviews.Content: First time in Istanbul and don't think we could have chosen a better hotel. The rooms are modern and spacious and the staff were fantastic - friendly and incredibly helpful. Its situated five minutes walk from a tram stop and right in the middle of a smart district full of cafes, bars and restaurants that are obviously v. popular with a young, local crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Design but far from sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: APBWestchester_NY
Reviews.Content: The Witt has gorgeous large rooms with flawless design and furnishings: leather couch, marble baths, leather headboard, glazed concrete ceiling. Top floor room 62 has fantastic view of old city from outdoor deck. Excellent assistance from hard-working staff. Well-prepared large selection of breakfast items allows one to skip lunch. Internet connection works great. But hotel is pricey and a hugely steep walk uphill upon return from tram after sightseeing. Had we known how far it was to the main attractions (Topkapi, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, etc), perhaps we would have selected a hotel closer to sites in Sulanhamet. But on the other hand, this area of town, Beyoglu, is hopping with the younger set of Istanbul and very few tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: VestFinnmark
Reviews.Content: This is an elegant hotel with very good service and good location. We were 6 girls celebrating our 40 anniversary in Istanbul and we are glad we chose this hotel. We got a great welcome with good information and recommendations from staff in Reception already on arrival. We stayed in two suites on the top floor and had a wonderful stay. The rooms were large, stylish and beautifully decorated with nice furniture and fixtures. We eat breakfast on the veranda every day and enjoy he tpanoramic view to the historic center. We followed the recommendations from the hotel both in terms of spa, restaurants, transportation and attractions. And all recommendations proved to be absolutely true! Great service attitude in all employees - no exceptions! Located in a quiet nice area in the modern part of Istanbul - perfect for shopping and cafe / restaurant visits. You do not have to stay in the stress that is often associated with tourist attractions, but it was easily accessible by a short tram or taxi ride. I highly recommend this hotell!

Reviews.Title: “SENSATIONAL HOTEL in a GREAT TOURIST CITY”
Reviews.Author: AKNY007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights at the Witt, a luxurious boutique hotel. Our large, very clean room had floor-to-ceiling windows that opened to a large terrace that faced the Sea and the Old City. Having a delicious breakfast here each day or lounging, was one of our greatest travel experiences ever ! Our very attractive modern room had flat-screen t.v., wi-fi, dvd and more. Well trained staff is very helpful. Excellent service all around here. Mr. Tuncel Toprak, General Mgr./Developer , was extremely cordial and informative. Hotel is in a great location, nearby to many top attractions and restaurants. Some readers of T.A. talk about the walk up the hill from the Tram to the Witt. My wife & I are in our 60's and not in great shape. We did this 10 minute walk , once holding our purchases from the Bazaar. This walk is very doable. I add, taxis are very plentiful and inexpensive in Istanbul. I can't say enough about how much we enjoyed our stay at the Witt !!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the new city of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: karens929_11
Reviews.Content: Located just above the docks in the new city, this hotel dazzles from the moment you walk in the front door. Great staff, beautiful lobby, and one of the nicest rooms we have ever stayed in. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Witt Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jesse D
Reviews.Content: My mom & I stayed at the Witt Hotel for 6 nights and each night proved to be more delightful than the next. The staff were attentive to all of our requests and provided us with great advice for things to do and see in Istanbul. Every morning the hotel provided an amazing breakfast- fresh fruit, figs, cheese, breads, yogurt and omelettes which kept us full for most of the day. The location of the hotel was very convenient for getting around Istanbul. The tram stop was a short walk from the hotel which provided an easy method to getting to The Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Spice and Grand Bazaar. Overall, we cannot say one bad thing about the hotel that would prevent us from coming back. Loved our experience at the Witt Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotelâ€¦ but TomTom might be even better”
Reviews.Author: ash5704
Reviews.Content: Great hotelâ€¦ but TomTom might be even better We stayed in room 32 at the Witt for four nights in mid-September 2011. Overall, our experience was very positive. The decor is very modern and cool. We were in a corner room with huge windows on two walls. The view was good, but we weren't quite high enough to have a view of the Bosporus. I'd highly recommend asking for a corner room (and ideally splurging on a sea view one). Oh - and one tip for the managers/owners â€“ higher wattage overhead lights would be helpful, the lighting in the room was really insufficient. Service at the hotel was warm and incredibly attentive. All staff members with whom we interacted were fluent in English and eager to address any need that arose. A small complaint: a staff member the first night recommended a restaurant that we thought served the worst dinner we ate in on our entire 2-week trip (and wasn't cheap). The breakfasts at the hotel, however, were very good. We loved the location of the hotel. Itâ€™s a residential area that feels a little less touristed than Sultanahmet. Also felt completely safe. Two nights we had long walks back from bars/restaurants late at night and felt totally comfortable. Even though I thought the hotel was impressive, I think if I could choose again, I might go for the TomTom Suites instead. The TomTom sounds similar in its small boutique size and modern style. And it may get a slight edge for serving breakfast on a rooftop terrace with an amazing view. I know the Witt has a great view as well, but you have to pay big bucks for the penthouse suite to take it in.

Reviews.Title: “Luxe Base in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: MarcDavid
Reviews.Content: A calm, modern oasis, The Witt is a great retreat and a convenient base for exploring this amazing city, located on the European-side in the pleasant and charming residential neighborhood of Cihangir (close to a tram stop). Large, open-plan rooms with great custom furnishings, a spa-like bathroom and a staff that always wants to be helpful combine to make this a highly recommended and luxe-feeling property at a relatively reasonable price. The only thing we missed was some kind of common outdoor space (a rooftop or a garden) but that said, we were quite happy in our very quiet and bright city-view suite, and we highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Most helpful staff imaginable!”
Reviews.Author: SallyKey
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel a bit harried by the crazy negotiating for a cab as we left our cruise ship. But once at the hotel, our attitude improved--the fellows who staff the desk at the hotel want to have everyone love their beautiful city. Though our room wasn't ready and we had already had breakfast on the ship, the staff insisted that we sit down for some freshly-squeezed OJ while we arranged to have our boarding passes printed for the next day's flight. They continued to help us arrange our day--where to find the tram (just down the very, very steep hill), where to find "fixed price" shopping, where to have lunch, and where to have a simply wonderful dinner for which they secured our table by the window. They also arranged for our cabs to dinner and to the airport to make sure that we were using cabs with meters. Our room (53) was wonderful, too--large with excellent accoutrements (great linen, marvelous rain forest showerhead, etc.) The only downside to this hotel is the location on the steep hill. After walking miles and miles around the city, the hill is a bit intimidating to a tired traveler. But if you can face that hill, then this property is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Simon19syd
Reviews.Content: An amazing hotel. Probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in anywhere in the world. The hotel is situated in the cool neighbourhood of Beyoglu and very close to Istiklal street (main shopping strip). You can also walk down the hill and you can jump on a tram and 5mins trip to all attractions around city. We were given the corner room on level 4 which had amazing views of the Bosphorus and Istanbul city. The room was large, spacious, modern and had big doors that opened up with spectacular view (see my photos). (Our friends god the room on level 1, although it was just as good, it didn't have a view) My wife loved the bathroom was decked out with Molten Brown. On the last night we were upgraded to the penthouse which was just amazing! Amazing memories drinking G&Ts on the roof and watching the sun go down over Istanbul. I would definately recommend this hotel. Pure luxury boutique hotel with an amazing view!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: blonddog
Reviews.Content: Close to everything but feels like an oasis of calm in the always busy city of Istanbul. Nothing to dislike about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible views from the rooftop”
Reviews.Author: JulieTampa
Reviews.Content: We just spent three wonderful nights in the Penthouse room of this great hotel. Talk about service.... It was superb. They spent over 30 minutes showing us a map and really making sure we understood how to get around and how to get where we wanted to go....Now about our room.... the penthouse.... WELL worth the dollars!!!! The view was unbelievable.... the Bosporus, the Blue Mosque and Ava Sofia were directly in front of us. At night the lights were so beautiful. We never closed our drapes. The room has a wraparound porch and we had breakfast brought up to us each day (at no extra charge). The breakfast was great and what a way to start your day. The room was very large and very comfortable with very modern dÃ©cor. The only slight negative, is that it is a steep hike from the tram. We solved the problem by taking the tram to the next stop and walking down instead of hiking up. Oh.... the elevator run by Mr. Witt brings a smile with each different floor.....

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended - a great value!”
Reviews.Author: purpleleaf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our family at the beginning and at the end of our trip. It is a wonderful, small hotel with a very modern and crisp aesthetic. The staff were incredibly nice and helpful! The rooms were large and very well appointed. I think they are one of the best designed hotel rooms and bathrooms, in terms of the details and fixtures they chose. And the location was great, in a non-touristy, trendy neighborhood. It is a short walk down a steep hill to get to the tram which will take you everywhere you want to go. And if you want some great restaurants, you just walk up the narrow streets and you will find a vast selection of restaurants, bars, and cafes. As the neighborhood is quite hilly, I would not recommend the hotel though for people who have difficulty walking up and down steep streets.

Reviews.Title: “1st rate experience.”
Reviews.Author: ClareMelbourne
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasure to stay at Witt Istanbul. We really appreciated the help and wonderful service of all staff members. Our suite was sparkling clean, beautifully designed, spacious and joy to return to after staring at ancient Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Just GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: MansourAldhlaan
Reviews.Content: Very beatiful hotel with nice staff, the only problem that we face is our stay was in Ramadan and they did not provide a meal instead of breakfast as most hotels in Istanbul do.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: ScandinavianTravel
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic experience and stay at the Witt Istanbul Suites. It was very clean and nicely decorated with Autobahn design furniture. All staff members were friendly and service minded, especially Onur, who I guess is native American due to his excellent English/language skills and understanding of excellent service. We had a lovely room (no. 62) on the top floor with a big terrace - with great views over the Bosporus and the historical peninsula. Breakfast was served in our room at no extra charge, which was highly appreciated. It was very obvious that the owner and management of this hotel focus on good service and guest satisfaction. The only negative thing I could say is regarding the sound from the room next to us. The walls of the hotel are so thin that you can clearly hear other people coming/leaving (and doing other things in their room) during the night, which was a bit disturbing. As the elevator was just outside the room, you also heard the sound from it. I would recommend that something is done about this. If you are looking for a small and modern boutique hotel in a quiet location with excellent service, this is the place to go. We had a much better stay than expected and would definitely stay at the Witt Istanbul Suites again if we return to Istanbul. However, when you go to Istanbul, be careful with cab/taxi drivers, who try to fool you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in charming location”
Reviews.Author: TRVLBG75
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights on our vacation and loved everything about the hotel. The room was spacious, modern and clean. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We also loved the location in a charming neighborhood close to all the big sites. We would definitely stay here again and will recommend it to all our friends

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel experience.”
Reviews.Author: Robin C
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay at the Witt. The Witt Istanbul is a gorgeous, trendy boutique hotel. Everything about this place was top quality. The design of the rooms and bathrooms was beautiful, and the rooms were exceptionally clean and comfortable. (The shower, with the multiple shower heads was a real hit with us!) Moreover, the breakfast buffet was wonderful, with options of freshly made omelets or an assortment of fruits (fresh and dried), cereals, cheeses, pastries, and more. Finally, each time we came into the hotel from having been out, the staff offered us complimentary bottled water. The owner and his wife were extremely nice people (he's a graduate of Rutgers) and very helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable hotel in memorable city”
Reviews.Author: canter0614
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my husband for 4 nights. I liked the hotel for the following reason: - The design and interior of the room was trendy and stylish - Room was huge with proper sitting area and had consideration for families. We did not use it but there was small & stylish kitchen attached - Bed was comfortable - Breakfast was delicious -Staff were super friendly, caring and helpful. - Located in the center area close to major areas where you can walk and enjoy the feel of that area -Love the shower with mutiple spa shower heads To talk about minor downside, the room we stayed (it was on 3rd floor) was a bit dark and didnt have a view - but again that was not a big problem. Overall, when I think about the hotel, it makes me have the memory of warm, kind and caring staff in cool and stylish boutique hotel in such a marvelous city.

Reviews.Title: “Can't add much to what has been said . . .”
Reviews.Author: doppios
Reviews.Content: The Hill - yes it's steep! Nespresso machine - BYO pods as they are 3 euro each! Nice organic/health food shop across the road that does a nice lemonade at its outside table Nearby Aga Haman very good and they will come and pick you up (just expect some typical Istanbul driving!) - 60TL a person + tip good wine shop 5 mins up the road - in-room wine cost 2.5 times as much nice breakfast, excellent Turkish coffee and the freshly-squeezed OJ keeps on coming nice library of guide books and general stuff about Istanbul but rather limited range of DVDs - unless you like action movies Great staff - very anxious to please (which they do) tram very handy Istanbul - its brilliant! Would definitely recommend this hotel if you are happy to spend the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: RCD33
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Witt for four days in August, and it was a great experience. The hotel has great decor, and the rooms were very nicely appointed and spacious. The shower may have been the best part- with five heads it was a welcome place to retire to after site seeing all day. The staff was very friendly and helpful and breakfast they put on every morning was terrific. I highly highly recommend this hotel (if you don't mind paying up) and want to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Helpful Staff, Great Rooms, Some Small Nits”
Reviews.Author: Globetrekker63
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at an independent boutique hotel in Istanbul (prior stays included both Four Seaons hotels, The Swissotel, the Ciragan Palace). The Witt Istanbul is definitely where I'll stay again- the location is ideal, in Cihangir, away from the blandness of Nistansi, away from the tourist quarter of Sultanahmet and without the traffic traps of major large five star hotels thanks to being walking distance from the tram (albeit with a steep climb uphill when walking from the Tram to the hotel, which is something we precisely sought out to burn all the calories we would be consuming in Istanbul's great restaurants). The hotel is full of furniture designed by Autobahn (a mod Turkish design company), so don't expect Iznik tiles and kilims. The rooms are spacious, and the sea view corner rooms 4th floor and above have amazing views across the Golden Horn. The breakfast is reasonably well done (not overly generous, but then again they don't have a full kitchen). Besides, there are a number of cafe's down the street that seemed to be buzzing at all hours, with bohemian secular Turks. The staff are very helpful, and try very hard- on occasion they get things wrong, but that's totally forgivable given their sincere attempts at being helpful. The crowd staying at the hotel at the time was not one that I would particularly associate with a mod hotel, and seemed to be comprised mostly of Americans, rather than my preconceived notion of style setters originating in cities like London, Tokyo and Milan. But unless you're offended by guests that cling to that frumpy JC Penny look, this is all neither here-nor-there. The rooms are beautifully done, very clean, with nice touches all around. The extra seating was particularly appreciated. The showers were large, with a very nice and mod shower head. A few nits though- the shelving above the kitchenette island was poorly conceived from a design perspective- banged my head on it twice. A female friend of mine complained of the bathroom lighting in her room as not suited to females, as well as the corian sinks which splashed too much water (they were nice to look at though...). Beware re the bed size- it's described as a "king", which is true enough in the European lexicon- but a European king is equivalent to a queen size in North America (a king size bed by North American standards is often referred to in Europe as a "super-king"). The hotel is very convenient from a logistics standpoint- walking distance to Beyoglu, Circurcama, the Istanbul Modern, Pera, the Galata area and the ferries at Kabatas. The tram at the bottom of the hill whisks you to Sultanahmet across the Galata bridge in no time - beats sitting in Istanbul's increasingly bad traffic. Overall, unless I am looking for a swimming pool to hang out by for part of the day, the Witt Istanbul is an absolute no-brainer- I would unequivocally recommend it and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nenia A
Reviews.Content: We travel often and we have visited a number of hotels around the world but we would easily pick this place as an absolute winner. Witt Istanbul will certainly be the hotel our future hotels will be compared to. We were in room 41, although city view, had lovely side views to the Sultanahmet, Galata Tower and the Bosphorus. Spacious, well decorated, spotless when it comes to cleaniness, our suite gave us the wow factor each time we entered the door and made us feel at home. Staff was very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The location is perfect if you count the proximity of the Tophane tram station, although the uphill walk from the tram station to the hotel may require a bit of workout before your visit! All in all Istanbul was amazing and this hotel a true jewel! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay in this boutique hotel. Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: navnov
Reviews.Content: We have travelled a lot and I must say Witt Istanbul has been one of the best hotel experiences we have had so far.... Customer Service - Everyone associated with the Hotel was superb in exercising their duty be it advice on Istanbul itineraries, fixing up a nice 'n cold Raki after a tiring day and climbing up the steep hill!, breakfast services, turndown services, cleaners of the room...EVERYONE! - All the employees had a genuine smile on their face all the time and we were genuinely interested in helping the guests. Room - Room is quite spacious. Around 60 Sq m. - We had a partial view of the Bosphorous/ Golden Horn and had views of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Yeni Mosque of Eminonu and Galata Tower. The city looked beautiful at night. - Spacious Bathroom with rainshowers.. - The only minor problem was with the flush which was a bit difficult to operate for a child... - Free Wi-Fi. - Free Breakfast (Egg Dishes, Dry Fruits, small pancakes, cheese platters, Breads, Turkish/English Teas, Turkish Coffee etc) Location - Located a nice place called Cihangir - 10 minutes walk to Taksim Square, Istiklal Ave - 5 minutes downhill Walk to Tophane tram station.. Coming up this hill is a challenge but there are many Taxis plying this hill to reach Taksim Square so you can hail one easily. - Lot of shops where you can buy essentials.. liquor shops, ATM around a 100 meter walk towards Taksim square. - 4-5 tram stops to the Old-Town. You need 1.75 TL to buy a token (Jeton) from the machine before boarding the train. The machines accepts notes of upto 20 TL... Children under 6 are free. My son is 8 and initially we bought tokens for him as well. However, one of the security guards just told me "Child Free" and he travelled Free on the Tram and the Funicular... The City: - Fabulous Fabulous place: The Old Town, Bosphorous cruise upto Anadolu Kavagi, Sitting on the shore near Kabatas with Turkish tea and overlooking the Bosphorous - To top it all, it was Ramazan and city just lights up in the evening. Its like celebrating XMas in the Western World or Diwali in India... Conclusion: - Istanbul, a must visit destination and Witt Istanbul an absolute must if you are in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel that we'd recommend and stay at again”
Reviews.Author: Taniwha_Blue
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Witt for five nights whilst in Istanbul to attend a friendâ€™s wedding. I totally echo the previous feedback for this hotel. The rooms are lovely and on the whole finished to a good quality, showers are amazing, there is ample space if youâ€™re staying for more than a couple of nights and the space is laid out well, the breakfasts are lovely (try the scrambled egg on toast), small muffins left in the afternoon feel like a naughty little treat, the service is on the whole very good (especially from the tall gentleman on reception) with nothing too much effort and any problems (such as our last minute cancellation of a restaurant that was difficult to book for and accidentally leaving one bag behind when taking a taxi to the airport) dealt with very efficiently and graciously. The welcome drink and chat with recommendations is a good touch. The location isnâ€™t in the middle of â€˜tourist Istanbulâ€™ however this is something that appealed to us and allowed us to experience a couple of different aspects to the city. The tram is only a few stops from the main attractions. The area felt safe and had some excellent cafes and restaurants, and a couple of mini marts. The Witt do deserve their high rating on Trip Advisor, but Iâ€™d urge them not to let it make them complacent or arrogant as this would lose them the advantage they currently have. If I had any constructive criticism it would be that they should ensure the service staff knock before entering the room (it happened once and they were very apologetic when they realised we were there during the day on that occasion), try not to look ever-so-slightly irritated when faced with an unusual accent that is more challenging to understand, ensure the reception is covered at all times during the night (we had to wait 10 minutes and make a (not cheap as it was a UK mobile) phone call to get access into the hotel when we returned from the wedding) and consider adding to the kitchen unit as currently the guest can use only the fridge and microwave. But overall this was a great hotel with wonderful staff and Iâ€™d have no hesitation in recommending them or, given the opportunity, staying with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: rivertrader46
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here at the end of a two week trip to Turkey. The rooms are large and very well equipped with a kitchen and sitting area. The bathroom is large and very modern. The hotel is not close the Sultanahmet tourist area but is near the Tram line and is surrounded by some steep hills which could be difficult for those who like to walk. The front desk staff are all very helpful with local information. We enjoyed eating at the nearby Hayat Cafe which they recommended.

Reviews.Title: “"What an amazing find"”
Reviews.Author: Barbi48
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is full of hotels, both large & boutique, I read reviews on Trip Advisor before I booked online. Now whilst it certainly doesn't offer fabulous views of Istanbul, we were so impressed with the high quality finishes and the size of the room, and as we were there for a week we could spread our selves out & chill & relax in the afternoon. The 6 head shower, wow, what an added bonus at the end of the day. Our breakfast which was included was amazing and we could have in our room if we so desired. Sometimes an added bonus whilst checking emails etc. 1st the in the morning. We thought the location great, we actually lived like the locals, & there were an abundance of restaurants, cafes and mini supermarkets nearby. A good10 minute walk to Taksim Square, worth the uphill effort, for a well need coffee or wine. I have to say I could not fault a thing, the staff were excellent & no task we asked for was a problem. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and we'll be back in the near future. 100 Stars from us. Loved it Jack & Barbi Melbourne Australia

Reviews.Title: “Awesome and we will be back.”
Reviews.Author: drsjadfoodie
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to thank everyone for their previous reviews on Witt Istanbul Suites. It is a wonderful place and the folks from Emrah to Anil and the folks serving breakfast were excellent and very helpful. It was our first time in Istanbul and they made it very enjoyable. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem - wonderful service and amazing rooms”
Reviews.Author: Travelingbiz
Reviews.Content: The Witt Istanbul Suites is an amazing hotel. It is very well designed and the staff are super friendly. All of the receptionists provided great advice and their recommendations were spot on including the hairdresser and the 'bÃ¶rek' (a form of Turkish pastry) shop. I rarely had a more professional service in a hotel. The room was impeccably clean and quiet and came with free Wifi. The breakfast in the hotel is truly amazing (the omelet is not to be missed). You are offered a rich choice and an added bonus is that you can have the breakfast in your room. The room has a small area to prepare tea etc. There is a Nespresso machine but the price for a capsule at 3 Euro a piece is a bit on the expensive side. The location is perfect, right in the 'hip' part of Istanbul with lots of restaurants, bars and shopping. Traveling to the Old Town for sightseeing is very easy using the tram. This part of Istanbul is very hilly and the way up to the hotel is steep but short. If you don't like the steep hill, you can always use a taxi. The receptionists can order you one and they even give you instructions to show the taxi driver on your return. It is surely a classy place with local charm and definitely one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blackbird2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed a few nights during the business trip. Room was modern, spacious and high quality. As a room was located in upper floors of the building it also provided peaceful rest without noise from the street - not always the case in a big, noisy city like Istanbul. Personnel was very friendly and always willing to help. Having stayed in more than fifteen different five or four star hotels in Istanbul I rank this hotel to be among the best ones and considering the price/quality it scores even better. Sincerely can recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service & great value”
Reviews.Author: joannetAustralia
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay at The Witt. The decor was great (especially loved the quirky Mr Witt in the elevator), the rooms were fantastic, so spacious with everything you needed and more, as well as spotless. The beds were also very comfortable. The service was outstanding, the concierge could do everything from book a restaurant for you to ordering food to your room late at night from a local restaurant, they were extremely helpful. The breakfast was also very good, the food was fresh with lots of choice. The location is good, especially if you would like to go out at night, there are a lot of excellent fine dining choices in this area with great views over the city. The tram stop is not far to walk to and can take you into the old town quickly and easily for sight seeing. The main thoroughfare, Istiklal Caddessi, is close by too. Best to wear comfortable walking shoes though because even though everything is in relatively close proximity you are constantly going up and down steep walkways. I would not hesitate to stay here again, it made our experience in Istanbul all the more outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Quality Perfect Service”
Reviews.Author: galata34
Reviews.Content: Perfect Services. Luxury Rooms Best Lobby Bar Restaurant Good pool Detailed Information URL:http://www.turkeyphotostours.com/

Reviews.Title: “The most superb hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Bonussima
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Witt for 10 days. I certainly can recommend this hotel even for longer stays in Istanbul. Hotel is located in a trendy neighbourhood with a lot of restaurants and small boutiques. The most kind staff I have ever met. Always helpful and oh so kind The spacious room (no 32 with a little view of the Galata Tower) gave me a cosy domestic feeling I did not want to leave the hotel. The breakfast was great ike among all other things of the hotel, the bathroom amenities of Molton Brown Thanks again for this wonderful stay in Witt

Reviews.Title: “We had an amazing time”
Reviews.Author: AliWalker66
Reviews.Content: The rooms were stylish, modern and so comfortable! They were fully equipped and cleaned impeccably on a daily basis. The service was extremely attentive- from the concierge to the cleaners. Delicious breakfast everyday of eggs, fruit salad, toast, pastries and tea. We absolutely loved our time in Istanbul and would highly recommend this as your base. Perfect location for all the sights.
