Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, amazing views & lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: DM45ESS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently with a large group of friends. Hotel is in a great part of town where there are lots of locals so you do not feel like you are too touristy an area, but it is also very close to the attractions. Very funky interior, rooms are very large, quiet and comfortable & we had a lovely view. There is no room service, but the kitchen was a bonus, as there were good food stores so we could buy food if we felt like eating in. Staff were really friendly & knowledgable & provided great suggestions. Overall it was a brilliant stay & I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place !”
Reviews.Author: Basima2000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at Witt . The staff were great specially Emrah who helped us discover many places in Istanbul. We enjoyed the wonderful breakfast. The rooms were modern new and clean! Loved the style !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: mehtap-ak
Reviews.Content: A great modern hotel in a great location with friendly staff and beautiful breakfast. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Great, but not a suite”
Reviews.Author: Jeff255068
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently for 5 nights in the Penthouse Suite. The Penthouse is worth every extra penny - the size, the sensational views, basically every good thing other reviews say. Staff were great, breakfast was great, and so on. The only thing is that we thought there would be a kitchen in the room as advertised, and that the word 'suite' meant multiple rooms. This was a fantastic over-sized bedroom and bathroom with it's own private balcony, but not 'suite' status.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great position”
Reviews.Author: lovecruisng
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights in April. We had a junior suite on the top floor with a balcony overlooking the Bosporus and the old city. The views from the room were stunning especially at dusk when the Hagia Sofia and the blue Mosque would be lit up. The hotel staff are wonderful and cannot do enough for you. Breakfast can be had in the foyer downstairs or in your room. Each day they leave chocolate muffins in the room. The room we had was very large and comfortableand having the balcony overlooking Istanbul was just magic. It is conveniently placed with the tram at the bottom of the hill about 200m from the hotel.[ It is a steep hill .] It is also about a 15 minute walk up to Taksim square. Great boutique hotel in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Can't speak highly enough of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: FiMacinLondon
Reviews.Content: We and friends booked out the whole hotel for five nights as part of a birthday celebration, and absolutely loved the hotel and its friendly, considerate staff. Emrah at reception was a notable stand-out. The hotel is beautiful inside, with knock-out views from the fifth and sixth floors. It is close to all the action in Beyoglu, an easy 15min tram ride from the bottom of the road to Sultanahmet, and a short drive to Ortokoy and its clubs. As everyone mentions, it is on a nasty hill from the river end but we mostly used cabs if going in that direction. Given how expensive some hotels in Istanbul are, the Witt is unequaled for value-for-money. It is quite close to a minaret and the 4.30am calls to prayer weren't appreciated, but I think that's common to much of central Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary designed offering in great location for seeing the sights and being close to the action”
Reviews.Author: Will_30something
Reviews.Content: Great place, clean and very friendly, willing to go the extra mile. Couldn't recommend it enough. Two downsides, no pool and if coming from the river side then a 200m hill to climb up. However don't let either of these put you off, as the rest of the offering easily made up for these. Incredible views from the penthouse over the city. W

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: diepnguyen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful with excellent location, a few minutes walk from Tazim Square. The best thing about Witt is the service from ALL the staff, especially Emruh. We absolutely love the gourmet breakfast buffet with the best quality of food and of course the service and the view from the lounge. This is the jewel absolute jewel of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: NorthmeadGlenn
Reviews.Content: Everything about our short stay here was fantastic. We were upgraded to the Penthouse Suite. What a room, what a view! Very stylish decor and a 180 degree balcony, with a view of the best part of the city. Staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: french7
Reviews.Content: We have just spent a wonderful couple of nights at the Witt Suites. Location, design, space, views, service, the Witt delivers wonderfully on all these. Breakfast was really nice too and Eurah at reception made great restaurant suggestions near the hotel. Witt is located in a district that is close to everything of interest for tourists and business people alike, yet in an area that feels authentic. Lastly, we felt the price to quality ratio was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: traveltheworld032
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms and lovely service. This place definitely caters to Americans and English speakers, which is fine (as I am both), but in a place like Istanbul, I prefer to get a bit more "lost in translation". No fault of theirs - they do a great job. Make sure you tell the taxi driver that you are near the "Italyon Hastanesi" - otherwise, no one knows about this place. Free wifi is a nice bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular view from the penthouse suites”
Reviews.Author: UrsulaR99
Reviews.Content: Spending the extra money for the suites is worth every Euro. The employees are extremely friendly and helpful, namely Aykut and Eurah from the reception are standing out. We liked the design of the hotel, the columns in the reception area are somewhat in the way. The location is very central, a 5 Euro taxi ride gets you to all places of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - loved it”
Reviews.Author: Brigilawson
Reviews.Content: Wow this is honestly the nicest boutique hotel. The service is amazing, the hotel design and rooms are beautiful (certainly helped with an upgrade to a sea view suite). It's located in a trendy area and away from packed tourist areas. All sites are just a 2-5min tram away. Would def stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A dream come too”
Reviews.Author: JB3000
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked the Witt over the phone from a park in Iran and wanted somewhere in Istanbul that would provide some respite after some serious travel in Central Asia. Everything, from the initial contact through to when we left the hotel, was outstanding. We had two suites and both were equally immaculate - sophisticated, contemporary, well designed and appointed. We would have stayed longer if we had time. We had stayed at a well-known (expensive) chain hotel last September in Istanbul and hands down, the Witt just gave and gave. The staff was so helpful, practical and responsive. Everything we requested was met. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to our families and friends. Thank you! Look out for the quirky Mr Witt asking you to take the stairs. A design delight ; )

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sasharhitekt
Reviews.Content: I took a group of friends to Istanbul to celebrate my 40th. The Witt was amazing in every way from start to finish. I could not have picked a better place to stay. A big thank you to all the friendly and attentive staff. If you can afford it stay in one of the penthouse rooms as the views over the golden horn and the old city are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we chose the Witt Istanbul Suites”
Reviews.Author: Mary1309
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Witt Istanbul Suites after cruising on Seabourn Odyssey. We were extremely happy with the hotel's clean, modern, roomy suites. The bed was very comfortable. The rooms were quiet and had great room darkening drapes for sleeping. But during the day the two sets of large windows gave us light and a view of the Hagia Sophia. Also the water pressure for the shower was great! The staff was friendly and very helpful with guides, restaurants and directions. The manager on duty spoke English. We had free WiFi. The kitchenettes had a small refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker and plates/glasses/utensils. The breakfast included with your suite was extensive and delicious: cold cereals, fruit salad, cheeses, meats, pastries, eggs, omelets and more. You can choose filtered coffee (coffee was much better than the cruise). The location was good - walking distance .from many good restaurants and shops. If we ever return to Istanbul we will gladly stay again at the Witt!

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel for a chic weekend in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: dollycake
Reviews.Content: My husband , myself and another couple stayed here three nights in April. The hotel looked exactly as it did on the website which I was extremely pleased about as it was the design of the hotel that initially attracted us to the Witt. The rooms are spacious and each contains its own small kitchen and bar area, excellent for pre dinner drinks, especially if you're travelling with friends. The staff were excellent and were extremely helpful, giving us heaps of advice on what to do in Istanbul and the best way to travel. Great location - very close to the tram stop as well as the main pedestrian shopping street and lots and lots of bars and restaurants. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem!”
Reviews.Author: nyctravelmommy
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 night stay at the Witt with my husband. It was absolutely fantastic! As soon as I booked the hotel 5 months prior to the trip, I received an email welcoming me and attached with tips about Istanbul. I requested an airport transfer and although I forgot to confirm before my trip, the driver was there waiting for us at the airport upon our arrival! I knew we were off to a good start!! When we arrived, Aykut was very helpful in going over all the important sites on a map. During our stay, I also received help from Anil in making sure we had proper dinner reservations and transportation back to the airport. The biggest star for us was Emrah! His English is perfect and he was simply delightful--he guided us to a place for drinks (Fifth Floor) and then dinner (Hayat Cihangir) by DRAWING MAPS for us!!!!!!! It was absolutely fantastic and I saved the pieces of paper as a memento! Not to mention, his recommendations were superb. The best meal we had in Istanbul (we had been there earlier in our journey but stayed at another hotel before touring around the country and returning to Istanbul) was at Hayat Cihangir and we would not have even known about it if not for Emrah. The room itself was great. We were on the 3rd floor and it was a very well sized space, almost like a studio apartment. The bathroom was wonderful with the 6 shower heads and I believe the floor might have been heated!! My only complaint would be the lighting in the bathroom but it's such a minor thing, I can't even really complain about it!! It was just a little dimmer than we would prefer but it fit in with the vibe of the whole place. The only other tiny thing I would suggest would be a doorman at the front door of the hotel because that door was realllllly heavy! But honestly, these are truly minor things in an otherwise perfect place. The breakfast every morning was full of incredibly delicious and varied choices--there was something for everyone and lots of it. It was all kept very neat and clean. I don't know the name of the man who was there to serve us our coffee and tea but he was just so pleasant to be around, especially first thing in the morning! You could also choose to have breakfast served in your room but we enjoyed being in the lobby and selecting all the yummy stuff on our own--plus we could go back for more! The location is fantastic but not for the out of shape or injured! It can be tough for people who are not used to walking, especially the steep hills and cobblestone streets. For us as New Yorkers, it was not a problem as we love to walk everywhere. We also loved being in the "hipster" neighborhood--reminiscent of the East Village in NYC or Williamsburg in Brooklyn. Lots of very cool cafes and restaurants. In close proximity to Taksim, Istiklal Caddesi and Galata Tower but still easy to get to all the tourist attractions via tram or even walking. Overall, we had a fabulous time and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who asks. I hope to return to Istanbul again and when I do, I will definitely stay at the Witt. Thank you for a wonderful experience!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant everything - I want to live here!”
Reviews.Author: Mark_in_Sydney
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel recommended somewhere - Wallpaper magazine I think. I loved everything about it. I had a suite on the top floor (room 62), which has a view straight out over the rooftops across to the Golden Horn and the heritage sites of the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, & others in the old town. We watched the ferries & ships come & go & the light change across the city. Service is fantastic& genuinely friendly - we arrived in a town car & were asked to pay in Euro, not Lira (our fault). The concierge, Aykut, immediately & without asking us got some money & paid the driver to help us out! This helpfulness was demonstrated by his other colleagues too (sorry, have forgotten your names guys!) The modernist design of the suite is brilliant - simple, clean, and luxurious without the try-hard extras put on by upmarket chains. Breakfast & in-room wi-fi is included. The location is 5 minutes to a tram stop, and 10 minutes to the main street (Isklital) and 10 minutes to Taksim Square. Across Galata Bridge to the old town is around 30 minutes. If I had to find a negative - which is hard to do - there is some noise from the small mosque next door, at prayer time. Being Istanbul means there's always a mosque close by, however Witt has double-glazed glass & reduces the noise considerably & it hardly bothered us. There's no gym, pool, business centre, valet - if you want average facilities like that stay at a generic hotel chain. This is a boutique hotel. Highly recommended & our first preference for accommodation next time we're in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The Witt Istanbul Suites Sets The Standard”
Reviews.Author: laurasbard
Reviews.Content: Our eight-day stay at the Witt Istanbul Suites was absolute perfection from beginning to end. Although the hotel is not in the Old City where all the major sites are located, it is still quite conveniently located in Beyoglu just up the hill (a bit daunting but you can do it!) from a tram stop (Tophane) that gets you to the Spice Bazaar and the Galata Bridge in two stops, and the major sites (mosques, Topkapi) in four-five stops. Nesting in Beyoglu was quite lovely, because the neighborhood, which is quite encompassing, was interesting and a bit offbeat with many little restuarants,, shops, bakeries and endlessly winding streets with surprises just around every corner; Taksim Square and Istiklar are also within easy walking distance. In short, Beyoglu was really quite convenient to everything. The hotel itself was stunning, with every possible amenity. The rooms are enormous and well-appointed with a spacious sitting area, perfect to come home to after a day of sightseeing. Breakfasts were something to be greatly anticipated--plentiful, fresh, and Turkish delicious, the perfect way to begin a day of active sightseeing. Browse a book from the wonderful little library and listen to music while sipping your Turkish coffee and being teated like royalty by the attentive and delightful staff. Most impressive was the front desk staff, in particular Emrah and Arkut, who so graciously assisted us in planning all of our sightseeing and restaurant reservations. They never seemed to tire of our endless questions, always at the ready with a map and a suggestion to make our days and nights in this fascinating and exotic city as memorable as possible. Their recommendations were always perfect. Without them, our trip just wouldn't have been the same. This is a hotel experience to savor--small and intimate, but without sacrificing luxury. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Witt”
Reviews.Author: dsayce
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Witt celebrating a birthday in Istanbul. The staff helped with various booking that we made before our arrival as well as arranging some flowers and wine in the room for our arrival. but what made this even more special was the birthday cake including candles too. The hotel itself is fabulous, wonderful rooms with the most amazing showers. Corner rooms are especially light, while views might be better on the higher floors (4+) the little park around the corner has sweeping views over the Golden Horn to the main tourist sights, perfect for a picnic! Very good brekfast, while the usual eggs are available on request, fresh fruits, yogurt, honey, dried figs together with breads and cheese are all there. A couple of small shops are a minute walk away if you need a few essentials and the area as a whole is very good with some great bars and resturants in a relaxed and yet vibrant part of town. Check out the Hyat Resturant around the corner or the bars just a few minutes walk away. The square and the main street are not far away and we had no problem walking to the main sights (although it can be quite hilly). It felt very much like a home from home, and we are alreay looking forward to our return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have chosen better”
Reviews.Author: AKAZengi
Reviews.Content: Helpful and courteous staff. No on-site restaurant, but the staff will order in for you at great prices. Generous, tasty, varied breakfast included--and delivered to your room if you want it. Very clean. Large, nicely decorated room with full kitchenette and big bed (no split down the middle). Big towels. Prestige toiletries. Yes, you can see the water from the sea view suites (beautiful at night, fascinating during the day). The rooms are quiet and comfortable. We felt fortunate to have been able to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveller01Berlin
Reviews.Content: It is the place to stay in Istanbul when you look for the luxury of a spacey room. The Witt is a small luxury boutique hotel with only 17 rooms - rooms with everything you need in perfection. Breakfast is great, staff is trying to make you feel very comfortable - and the location is perfect as you can make many attractions by walking through very picturesque little streets with nice coffee shops, restaurants and local handicraft.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Awesome all around. What truly made our stay special was the spacious perfectly decorated comfortable room with a great view of the city. The staff was unusually helpful especially with restaurant recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel, with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: LSandA
Reviews.Content: We were on a city break in Istanbul for 5 nights in April with our 5 year old daughter and chose to stay at the Witt having read all the excellent reviews on Tripadvisor. We were not disappointed. The hotel is located on the European side of the Galata Bridge, but all the major sites in the Old City are easily accessible by tram, and the tram stop is just a few minutes walk away. The little winding streets around the hotel are also worth exploring - we stumbled across some very interesting antique shops. The room was lovely and big, with a great little kitchenette and luxurious bathroom with a rain shower and underfloor heating (which was fab, as the weather was unseasonably cold when we were there!). The breakfast was excellent - fresh bread, locally sourced honey and preserves, pancakes, eggs to order, fresh coffee and unlimited freshly squeezed orange juice. But it's the service that really stands out - all the staff were excellent - friendly yet professional, offered help and advice when required, and the gentlemen at the front desk - Aykut during the day and Emrah in the evenings were brilliant with my 5 year old (she even got a whole box of her favourite mini-cupcakes to take home on the day we were leaving!!). We didn't have a problem with the steep climb to the hotel, although it would probably be quite tricky for very young children or people with mobility problems. All in all, we had a lovely stay and will definitely be recommending this hotel to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: aniaolek
Reviews.Content: When my husband whisked me off to a surprise weekend in Istanbul this January, he couldn't have picked a better hotel! The rooms are beautiful - large, modern and comfortable; we especially loved the "rain" shower. I think the best part was enjoying breakfast in the room while appreciating the stunning view of the city. But what really put this hotel over the top was the great, great service, which you just can't get at a large hotel. We were treated like good friends (in a courteous, but very friendly way) and every member of the staff did their utmost best to ensure that we have the best experience possible. The hotel is perfect - I really cannot find anything to fault!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely incredible”
Reviews.Author: JasonFJ
Reviews.Content: To say the Witt Istanbul Suites exceeded our expectations is to say the least. What a top quality hotel and what a pleasure to stay there. Our experience began with a very personable greeting by the manager who arranged seats and drink while we signed in. The room decor, style and sophistication is unlike anything I've ever seen - you have to see the photos to believe it! Special mention has to go to the heated bathroom floor and the amazing overhead shower which has to be experienced to appreciate it! As someone else's review mentioned.. the suites can function as a bedroom, lounge, bar and handle every situation with a style that obviously had a great deal of interior decoration thought put into it. The expresso machine that is part of the open plan deserves special mention. Breakfast and the staff there were equally amazing. The breakfast is Turkish style, the staff polite and friendly and the food quality and preparation is top quailty. I have to mention George, one of the duty managers. Quite possibly one of the most professional staff I've ever met who went to great lengths to recommend nearby restaurants, accomodate our silghtly oversized car, and even cooly handled my slightly annoyed phone call when we thought we had left some items behind that couldn't be account for (the missus discovered them buried in a bag after all). A total professional - thank you George for all your help and patience. In closing: if you can get a room at this hotel I would without question skip on the more expensive 5 and 6 star hotels and stay here. It may not be the silver spoon room service you get at the big hotels, but the quality and experience is worth it a hundred times over.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that knows the true meaning of service and customer service”
Reviews.Author: billr50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this conveniently located boutique hotel for a week. We enjoyed everything it had to offer including friendly and obliging staff, very clean rooms, excellent facilities and very comfortable king size bedding. It is also very quiet. It's located in a cool suburb near Taksim which offers everything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: MH2806
Reviews.Content: We received great service from arrival to departure. We were warmly greeted, offered a drink then given the key to our suite. The suite was as described - comfortable big bed, nice sitting area, small kitchenette and a fabulous bathroom. We were on the first floor so we had some street noise, but that's common in any major city and ear plugs dealt with it. The breakfast (included in our rate) offered cooked-to-order eggs / omelettes, freshly squeezed orange juice, marvellous home made fruit salad, yoghurts, pastries, cheeses, meats etc etc. Again with warm and charming service from the two breakfast waiters. The location is good, being about 10 minutes walk from Taksim Square (not in itself a particularly pretty sight) on typically shoddy Istanbul pavements (which, for the less mobile or poorly sighted, include unguarded drops down to property front doors, uneven and broken paving, crumbling steps etc etc). The tram to the historic sights in Sultanahmet is straight down a steep hill, only about a five minute walk, but you have to walk in the road as the pavements by that part of the street are to all intents and purposes non existent. To get to Istiklal (the main street on the European side of the city) the quickest and for us easiest way was a route involving many steps and astonishingly steep hills which brings you out on the street about half way along. For the less mobile or fit a taxi would be better. Incidentally, traffic seemed well used to avoiding people walking in the street and it appeared preferable to follow the locals and take what seemed a small risk of being run over rather than face a significantly greater risk of a sprained ankle or broken leg from misjudging the pavement. The best things about this hotel? The room, the staff, the service and the breakfast. All fantastic. The receptionist even managed to get us a table at 360 (one of the best restaurants with a view) at short notice on a Friday night. The worst? Two small issues. First, the individually controlled air conditioning was anything but, and the weather still being quite cold would only pump out hot air (and therefore overheat the room) as that was the setting decided by hotel management. I wasn't the only guest to complain about that and the hotel should fix this so that individually controlled means just that. Second, the hotel provides a Nespresso machine in every room but charges 3 Euro for every capsule used. So we didn't use them. Either provide the machine and the capsules as an amenity or don't bother would be my suggestion. Addressing these two small points would make a really great hotel superb. All in all this hotel truly deserves its Tripadvisor rating.

Reviews.Title: “Service, Location, Design and Views - Excellent”
Reviews.Author: applebinisland
Reviews.Content: We feel so lucky to have found this hotel. The suite was beautifully designed and suited us perfectly. Yes, the shower is fantastic. We had a commanding view from our room which added to the Istanbul experience. The staff took such great care of us. Remembering our names and going above and beyond expected assistance. The lounge was comfortable and nice with a public computer and satisfying breakfast. The neighbourhood couldn't be beat. It had a local feel, close to transport, winding lanes of vintage shops, a pedestrian street with a great vibe, shops and restaurants and much more. This hotel set the tone for our wonderful, memorable trip to Istanbul. A city which now ranks among my top favourite big cities of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Really perfect”
Reviews.Author: Alexandre92100
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful stay we had at this hotel. We stayed there twice, first in room 31 then on the penthouse nÂ°61. Both were really great. The VERY big bonus of the penthouse is the amazing view. By staying there you can even afford not to visit to the Galata tower!. The hotel is modern, very well designed and extremely practical. The rooms are big with everything you need. They really know what "less is more" means, especially when it's about good quality products. The breakfast is really good. As it's a small hotel, the atmosphere is really like a home away from home. The location is perfect. Close to Taksim Square with great bars, restaurants and shops but also close to a tramway station which takes you in 10min to all the monuments you have to visit when beeing is Istanbul. A very special mention to the gentlemen at the reception desk. All of them were extremely nice, giving tips to restaurants, baklava shop and precious other information, always with a smile and a good mood. You have to stay there if you go to Istanbul. And yes, the little "climb" on the hill from the tramway station to arrive there is really worth it!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel to be enjoyed as much as the city”
Reviews.Author: EBB_MAD
Reviews.Content: Apart from the interiorism (cool but local, with its own personality), Witt Istanbul is a place where someone has already think about what you need. Your room can be used as a bedroom, a bar, a restaurant or a lounge. With the things you like and with the company you want because you don't have to share spaces with other guests if you donâ€™t want. If you want to have a drink or eat you have some things in the room but you can buy what you need very close to the hotel (a bottle of wine, fruit, chipsâ€¦). You can also have the same breakfast in your room that you have at the buffet in the hotel bar: choosing what you want and with a local newspaper in English. A perfect place for a trip if you like a combination of cultural visits, walks and local food with quality resting time at your room. Nice restaurants are very close to the hotel: small, trendy, local, international... Also Witt havea personal and friendly service. Ask for anything you need at the hotel desk, including the nice tea glasses where tea is served (designed by Faruk Malhan).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Greatr Staff.”
Reviews.Author: viri
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Witt Suties for about two weeks in mid January. The staff cannot be faulted for their politeness and eagerness to server. Was given a very good deal by the receptionist which by far made it more compettive than the Five Star hotels nearby. Needed some extra utensils for the kitchen in my apartment and they immediately took me down to the Hotel Kitchen to select what I needed. Room was huge, with a nice walk in shower. No gym and you have to walk about two hundred metres to the City Square. This was no problem for me but for others it might be. However, many a taxi pass by.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, urban, small boutique hotel, centrally located with sublime views”
Reviews.Author: blrach2
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here in April. We were upgraded to the top floor room (62) which has fabulous views over central Istanbul and the Bhosporous, which are particularly lovely and twinkly at night, and look great from the balcony. Our room didn't have a kitchenette as described, and I would say it was a large good quality hotel room rather than an apartment room, but everything you needed was there so we didn't mind, and the shower was particularly enormous. They are going for the urban converted warehouse look and it all works rather well. The hotel is very centrally located, very close to a tram stop for getting to the main sights in 10 minutes , and the right side of town for eating and drinking in the evening. You could walk to the main bars and restaurants, but the very steep hills in Istanbul put us off this option. The service was very polite and helpful, and we liked the fact that you got a free drink on arrival, and whilst we were waiting for our taxi. They didn't just pile up the extra charges like so many British hotels do. Also we had breakfast in bed everyday for no extra charge. The only small downside is we got woken by the call to prayer at 5 am every morning, but this would be the case anywhere is Istanbul, and when mixed with the sound of the horns of the ships on the river it was all suitably foreign and exotic! I would highly recommend this for anyone wanting a centrally located hotel for sightseeing and evenings out. However as parents of 2 young kids I'm not sure I would bring them. The hills would be a killer with toddlers and babies and I'd be a little worried about hyper kids ruining the laid back ambience of the hotel, even though I'm sure the hotel would be friendly. As a place to get away from your children, as we did, it's perfect

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is epitome of style and comfort with unbeatable service”
Reviews.Author: IrelandSuki
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in the Witt Istanbul. We loved every second of it. The room (on the first floor) was so stylish with kitchen facility and an amazing bathroom with multiple shower heads. It catered for every need you might have. The breakfast which was typical turkish fare, is served downstairs in a very stylish lobby area or, with no extra charge, in your room. Every need you might have, any advice you seek, is catered for. The area is very interesting and a nice foil to the more tourist area of Sultanahmet. It's full of really interesting shops, cafÃ©s and restaurants. Can't say enough about the hotel. Will return as soon as we have the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel rooms in a extraordinary athmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Binsmudo
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in this very nice hotel with its extraordinary athmosphere. From the hotel is a 5 minutes walk from the tramway that brings you to all the touristic spots such a the Agia Sofia and the blue mosque.The hotel room was big, nicely furnitured and very clean. Free WLAN in the whole hotel. The service (breakfast and reception) was very good and they were all extremly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Sylish and immaculate room and welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: Bilje113
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and loved the style of this modern hotel. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The breakfasts were very good and nicely presented. The location was convenient for the tram system and within 10 minutes walk of a large number of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “every time you come back you feel like you came home.”
Reviews.Author: khammas
Reviews.Content: very friendly and very helpful staff. they know the best retaurants and you can blindly trust them. roomd are clean . design of the rooms is wonderful. I liked the location as well. am trying to find something I didn't like but there is not..! I's not for people who are looking for luxury fancy hotels . it's for us who are looking for a quite romantic place to hide. !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Monkey38
Reviews.Content: We went for for my partners birthday I let the hotel know that it was a surprise and there was great surprise for us both when we got to the suite there was cake waiting for us From the pick up from the airport, to the check in at the Hotel, to the room service breakfast, to the advice on where to go to eat was excellent. All of the staff were willing and eager to help. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “TOTALLY worth the climb up a hill”
Reviews.Author: iseemoto
Reviews.Content: I normally don't bother writing reviews but an exception has to be made for the Witt Istanbul. We stayed in a City View suite between Christmas and New Year, and it was everything we had hoped for and more. One of the first things my boyfriend said when we entered the room (gawking) - "If only I had a bachelor pad - this is what I'd want it to look like." Not to say that the room was couple-unfriendly (oh far from it), but the interior design was very modern and stylish, managing to balance between on-trend (think marble surfaces, metal lamps, stainless steel-equipped kitchen island, plasma TV) and elegant (well-placed wooden panelling, leather settee). Enough people have raved about the bathrooms (six showerheads! Molton Brown heaven!) - we wanted to take a bath after climbing the hill (more on that below), but gladly settled for lack of bath(tub) and had a fantastic shower instead. The suite was very spacious and the bed was extremely comfortable (with a stylistic headboard to boot). The staff are genuinely friendly and impeccable in their service - the receptionist who greeted us spend ages showing us where to go and what to see on a map; a request for an unusual nightcap was dealt with as best as possible by an employee who must have been, as we only later deduced, completely teetotal); incredibly, we were able to order breakfast in as room service - it involved simply ticking off choices on an order card, hanging it outside the room door and voila, breakfast arrived at the time requested in the morning with no additional "room service charge". The hotel is located in a quiet residential area on a hill, and therefore trying to get to the nearest transport hub involves a bit of an uphill-downhill trek, but not undoable (good exercise!) All in all, a fantastic experience - we can't imagine staying anywhere else if we do visit Istanbul again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Less than Heaven”
Reviews.Author: EANYC
Reviews.Content: Trying to describe our stay at the Witt is akin to making a list of superlatives. We recently spent 9 nights in this little heaven of a hotel in the trendy area of Cihangir, a close walk from Istanbulâ€™s center, Taksim Square. From the moment you step your foot in this hotel, you will feel as if you have arrived home. The hotel is decorated as a warm and inviting place, which it most definitely is. Everything imaginable is thoughtfully provided. The rooms, suites really, are enormous; they are comfortable, clean, luxurious, appointed with every comfort: a divine feather bed; a bathroom that is equipped with a six-head shower and seemingly unlimited goodies from Molton Brown; a kitchen â€˜island,â€™ complete with microwave oven, a Nespresso machine, utensils, and refrigerator; a work area with an iPod dock and hotel-wide free WiFi; and a sitting area with a flat-screen TV and CD/DVD player. By the lobby, there is a sitting and reading area; one can borrow one of many guides on Istanbul and Turkey; take a book, magazine, or DVD to enjoy in your room; check email on a public iMac; or even borrow an iPad from the reception area for the duration of the stay. This is also where breakfast is served; it is breakfast without confinesâ€”you may order eggs as you wish to have them; a second or third fresh-pressed juice. The breakfast buffet is as inspired as the rest of the hotel: yogurt, nuts, fruit, cereals; but also cheese, cold cuts, breads and cakes. As enthusiastic I sound about the hotel itself and its amenities, words do not suffice to describe the warmth of the hospitality, the kindness and professionalism of the staff, and the eagerness of everyone to be of service. This is no run-of-the-mill hotel service. I happened to have a medical emergency while staying there and I could feel the staff caring for me as if I were family. Emrah, Aykut and Onur who staff the reception area are not only knowledgeable, eager, and courteous professionals; they are also warm and caring friends. This is more than a boutique hotel; it is more than a luxurious hideout with impeccable service. This is a destination in itself. I was sad to leave the hotel and the staff at the end of my trip, but I have no doubt I will stay there again on my next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ArchwayLis
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay in Istanbul. The suites are very spacious and comfortable with some great little touches such as free cakes and the option of having breakfast served in your room. The breakfasts are excellent - some days we didn't need lunch. The staff are all incredibly friendly and helpful - on everything from restaurant recommendations and bookings to sightseeing tips and itineraries. Witt is also in a good location, with shops, cafes and restaurants nearby and many sights within walking distance. A really special place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “SLEEK AND SEXY WITH A COZY FEEL IN THE BEST AREA OF ISTANBUL”
Reviews.Author: piscesboy1
Reviews.Content: My partner, Mark, and I stayed at the Witt at the tail end of February 2011. We just returned tonight, and I am writing immediately to share our experience. The staff greeted us with genuine smiles from the moment we arrived, and continued to guide us ( when curious ) with places to visit that suited our needs and general "vibe." They are, in a nutshell, the best team of hotel staff we have ever met. Breakfast in the morning is excellent, and this is a bonus as the area comes alive late at night. Great to sleep in and wake up to a tasty meal served in a chill, yet upscale environment. Funky music. ;) Sexy decor in the huge suites. Room 12 has a great view of the Mosques in the distance. SO comfortable. Has the feel of your own, new upscale apartment. Clean and sleek. In the heart of a funky new area of town with bars, shopping, cute cafes, etc Gay-friendly which is a bonus for those who are into the bar/club scene as this area is at the heart of it all. The WITT is THE place. We will DEFINITELY be back.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hig Spec Rooms - Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: slumbermonkey
Reviews.Content: This hotel really is exceptional. Rooms are high spec, staff are outstanding and helpful. I think the service is made all the better by the fact that there are only 14 rooms so the hotel has an intimate cosy feel. Breakfast is a small buffet but has more than enough variety. Free Wi-Fi. Location - Getting up the hill from the metro is a mission there's no getting around it. Plus it's not an area to get lost in, lots of small hilly road, very confusing to get around. Did miss not having gym or spa facilities. Tip - There is a roof terrace which is empty but you can go up and get an awesome view of the city by night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nfilo
Reviews.Content: Great expirience staying at this hotel which is near the center of Istanbul.It has a trendy design with lots of comforts.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, spacious hotel on a good location”
Reviews.Author: Maxadam
Reviews.Content: The Witt is a really nice small hotel, i think they have about 15 rooms, but all are suites, so plenty of space. The hotel is quite new, and lovely design. The staff is friendly and warm. The location is good, near the Taksim square in the newer part of the city. Absolute good value for your money. And free internet :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view, trendy & design room and kind staff”
Reviews.Author: antoinparis
Reviews.Content: Witt hotel in Istanbul is definitely one of the best place to stay. The room are spacious, with design furnitures. The whole staff are kind and customer oriented

Reviews.Title: “modern hotel in a lively neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: tripartist
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Syria, we decided to have a stopover in Istanbul in each direction, and chose the Witt as our stopover hotel. We were allowed an early check-in, for which we were grateful, as we were jet-lagged after a long flight. There was little to complain about at the Witt. The rooms look exactly like the photos on their web site. Theyâ€™re spacious....no wide-angle photography necessary! We enjoyed the lively neighborhood, full of cafes, shops, and groceries, with a very good wine shop just a few blocks away. Having previously stayed several times in the Sultanahmet, we were glad of a change of location. Their breakfast buffet was quite good, all you could expect, with some of the largest fresh figs weâ€™ve ever seen. When we returned from Damascus, we were presented with a complimentary bottle of wine...a nice touch. Supposedly we were given one of the biggest rooms in the hotel, but it looked about the same size as our first room. As it was a corner room, though, it was sunnier from the extra window, which had a nice view partial view of Istanbulâ€™s exotic skyline. On our last day in Istanbul, there was a suicide bomber in Taksim Square that morning, a few blocks from the hotel. No one at the hotel mentioned it to us, although we knew something was up due to the presence of news crews at the hospital across the street. I realize there was nothing to be done about it after the fact, but I feel itâ€™s important to keep guests up to date about significant events in the immediate area. One thing about the Witt that wonâ€™t affect most guests is the presence of many heavy doors. I had an injury the day before we left on our trip that made it impossible for me to open and close their doors. Since I was traveling with my husband, it wasnâ€™t an issue, but a solo traveller in a similar situation might have a difficult time. Aside from this, we had an enjoyable stay, and would recommend their modern hotel and pleasant, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “simply wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: ViaggiaForFun
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at Witt istanbul Suites in June and could not have been happier. The hotel is very unique in that the rooms are all very large and comfortable, extremely well furnished in a modern Turkish fashion, and make you feel like part of your trip is the hotel experience. The penthouse suite is divine, the view of the city is amazing. The staff was very friendly and helpful, especially Aykut at the front desk, extremely accommodating. There is no restaurant in the hotel but they do serve a good breakfast. One small issue is probably just that, not having a food service outside of breakfast. Second issue is the steep hill that you need to climb to get to the hotel from the tram stop! But taxis are cheap, however they could probably solve the issue by offering a better private car service, as taxis in Istanbul are a nightmare. Finally, bathrooms without real doors in hotel rooms are not cool no matter what your relationship is with your roommate. This was an issue in the penthouse suite.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable”
Reviews.Author: Give_me_motion
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights and didn't want to leave. Beautiful room, great location, fantastic value, impeccable service. Every last detail whether it's furnishings, design or service has been thought through. This place cannot be faulted. Definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheVastMachine
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large and stylish and come with a complete kitchen. The breakfast buffet is pretty good, comes with a hot dish as well as the standard array of Turkish breakfast items. The hill leading down to the tram is indeed a bit steep but should be fine for most people. Some other reviewers have noted that taxi drivers either couldn't or wouldn't find the hotel, but I took plenty of taxis and never had a problem. Restaurant recommendations were spot on as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, great, amazing place - stay here, dont even think twice ...”
Reviews.Author: eos7
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot and, when staying in cities, always spend some time trying to find reasonably nice, unique, smaller style hotels, avoiding overly tourist-conveyor-belt type areas and large hotels. We generally manage to end up in pretty good places - however NEVER has a hotel been as absolutely perfect for us as this one. Best feature of the hotel is its design - unique and quitue cool design, really high quality furnishings, light, incredibly spacious and well laid out suites (with sitting and kitchen / bar area these are definately "suites" rather than just rooms.... very comfortably had friends over for a drink). Great views. Just extremely comfortable, lovely accomodation to be in. Location perfect - walking distance (if you like a walk, otherwise close to tram) from the big sights, but also far enough away from all of this, in its own quite cool area that is removed from the more tourist laden spots and really just a great part of istanbul to be part of.Staff / service were great - attentive , efficient and welcoming. Breakfast nice. Definately stay here.

Reviews.Title: “STYLISH”
Reviews.Author: fionaandbenny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a recommendation from friends and this is what friends are for, The room was excellent stylish and comfortable very well maintained with a beautiful bathroom, the staff are very attentive and courtious and spoke very good english, nothing seemed to be too much trouble for them and all were happy to answer any questions we had, all in all a very enjoyable stay and we will definately be returning to both Istanbul and this hotel

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm and comfort in a huge city”
Reviews.Author: SMLBARB
Reviews.Content: From the moment we first stepped into the lobby of the hotel we knew it was going to be a wonderful place for a few days. We were warmly greeted by Emrah and Onur at the front desk and given cold drinks and towels - (we had wandered in circles on an unusally hot day). Emrah sat with us and spent 20 minutes showing us where we were, how to get places, sites to see and much more. This hotel is very modern and contermporay in decor and amenities. The lobby is cool and comfortable and a welcome respite from the activity of Istanbul. Our room was huge and so comfortable. We had a large sofa and chair along with a bar equipped with fridge, microwave and coffee maker and electric kettle. The bathroom was fabulous with a huge walk-in shower - and five shower heads (maybe more). After coming off a cruise - it was a real treat. There was tons of storage space and room to spread out. We had a lovely little Juliet balcony with a great view of the Galata Tower and the rooftops of the city. The morning light was magical as it reflected on the buildings. After a day of seeing the sites, walking for miles, and rubbing elbows with the 16,000,000 people who call Istanbul home, the Witt Suites was truly an oasis. But as wonderful as the room was - the staff were the best part. Emrah was helpfula nd anxious to ensure we got to see the best of Istanbul. He helped me with my feeble attempts to speak a few words in Turkish.. Breakfast was very nice - served in the lobby with a lovely variety of foods and even made-to-order omelets. The staff at breakfast were so nice and a pleasure to speak with - obviously pleased to share their knowledge of their culture and city. The location of the hotel is excellent - yes there is a very steep hill you need to ascend from the Tram station - but just take it slow. But you can easily walk to lots of restaurants and shops as Taksim Square is withing walking distance as is Istaklal street (pedestrian shopping street). We wouldn't stay anyplace else when we return to Istanbul. This is a wonderful place and so reasonable for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Witt was the perfect place for us! - Excellent Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mile high traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the smaller penthouse suite (top floor) for a week and it was perfect. Stunning views of the old city and a very comfortable room with large balcony (sitting area both inside and out). The Witt staff were friendly and always helpful with recommendations of where to go and how to get there. The staff went above and beyond normal duty to help us find those special items we were hunting for in the city. The breakfasts (included with the stay) were the perfect way to start each day exploring the city. We loved the chocolate muffins at the end of each day - a very special touch! (Also, there's a small market just a block away to help avoid some of those high-priced honor bar items in the room.) The free WiFi in the room worked well with iPhone and iPad (although, I think the internet speed was a bit slow because it couldn't handle skype calls very well). Regarding location - It's on a quiet street away from the crowds, yet an easy walk to Taksim or Istiklal pedestrian areas. As many other reviews mention, the walk downhill to the tram is short but steep. The trek uphill to the hotel after a long day on your feet can be challenging. However, we viewed the challenge as a good way to burn off those extra treats we consumed throughout the day. If walking is a problem, I might recommend using taxis or another hotel. But we wanted a quiet, elegant place in Beyoglu away from the crowds and easily accessible to the old city and Witt was perfect in every way!

Reviews.Title: “Divine Design”
Reviews.Author: stina_10
Reviews.Content: We were happy to stay at this hotel in mid-October. Us - two adults and our 3 year old daughter. We had the best of times, with a friendly staff, a beautiful and quiet suite and a view to die for. The location was also great, you need good legs for the quite steep hills surrounding, but you will get rewarded with good restaurants, shops and genuine atmosphere nearby. The tram to take you to the other side of the Galata Bridge is also within short walking distance from the hotel. Warmly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: DCSnt
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the hotel Nov 16 - 24, 2010. The pictures on the hotel website are exact!! We were very comfortable, I love when hotels have wood floors - just seems cleaner. The breakfast was great. When we arrived to the hotel it was around noon and breakfast ends I think around 11. The hotel staff still offered us the complimentry breakfast which was great because we just came from a 10 hour flight and I don't eat airplane food. The staff is also amazing which makes the trip and experience even better. Aykut was very helpful. He told our cab drivers where to go (since I don't speak the language) and when I mentioned that I came here to celebrate my birthday - on my birthday there was cake waiting for me in my room that day! Very lovely surprise and greatly appreciated. Everyone in the hotel was very helpful and pleasant. I would DEFINITLY stay at that hotel again. The location is fine. A quick taxi ride to the many areas. You can walk to Taxsim. I will say when you take the tram and you come back home to the hotel - that hill is no joke! And I work out! The hill is soo freakin steep! But you do it - you only have to walk up that hill if you are coming back to the hotel from the Tram or walked down that street. Anyway, don't look further, stay at this hotel its the best - clean, great breakfast ( i mainly stayed there for the rooms and complimentry breakfast), great staff!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: grepat
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. We tayed there for three days (27/11-30/11/2010) and find this hotel to be really what all the enthusiastic reviews described. Elegant design, spacious rooms, very good location, friendly and helpful staff. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fabulous!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LLP16
Reviews.Content: I have to say this is now my favourite hotel. Everything about this hotel is fabulous. The staff are incredibly helpful with anything you may need. All the restaurants that were recommended were great....Changa (only a short walk from the hotel) is one I would highly recommend. Our open plan spotlessly clean suite was spacious and modern with well designed furniture . We had lots of natural light from the four large windows in our suite that opened on to small balconies. We looked forward to returning to our suite every night and to the chocolate cupcakes left in our room ( a very nice touch). The included breakfast was delicious and you could either eat in the breakfast room or have it brought to your suite. The location in the Beyoglu neighbourhood was perfect for us. We could walk to Taksim and to Istiklal Caddesi -the major shopping street full of shops, restaurants and bars. The tram station was just a short walk down the hill that would take us to Sultanhamet . We could also walk to Istanbul Modern -the museum of modern art. I have to say that we felt very safe walking in this neighbourhood even late at night. With such a great location, amazing staff and a beautifully designed hotel, why stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “It feels like coming home!”
Reviews.Author: firstalways
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W the first night we arrived in Istanbul and our friend requested that we should try Witts and we did. We stayed there two nights and loved it. It is mins' walk away from public transport and is in a quite nighbourhood. The rooms and the common areas had all you could expect out of a design hotel. Our room was very spacious and was equipped with an open kitchen. I expect another longer stay next next we visit beautiful Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “one of the loveliest hotels we have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: suzanneoconnor
Reviews.Content: we stayed rather a long time at the witt ,12 days all together and could not have been happier.our suite was charming, modern elegant and excellently appointed.the view was a constant delight with the ever changing vista of the bosphorous and the old city. the front desk staff could not have been more helpful and agreeable. interested and knowledgeable. breakfast was always delicious and we particularly enjoyed the assorted turkish dishes coffee and tea and cool drinks were constantly available upon request in the lobby.and always served with a smile. kitchen in suite clever and well designed.[we chose to eat out always] bed linen crisp.bathroom very commodious and bright . we actually could not fault the hotel. and all of the staff were outstanding

Reviews.Title: “excellent view...”
Reviews.Author: Ankitjain
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this property for a weeks time and we were booked in the penthouse suits situated in the property....staff was amazingly friendly and helpful....clean and tidy rooms with a panoramic view from the front balcony was a cherry on the cake......

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous experience”
Reviews.Author: virgilandelsie
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Witt were amazing- really well designed rooms with beautiful furniture, great clean bathrooms with Molton Brown toiletries. A great buffet breakfast was included in a lovely breakfast room. The staff were very helpful and welcoming. The area is interesting and at the chaotic end of the Istanbul spectrum, but close to some lovely restaurants and the Istanbul Modern. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, great location and very helpful/ friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Greaney
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights of our honeymoon in the Witt Istanbul suites. With the build up to the wedding, we hadn't managed to do much research into Istanbul, apart from booking this hotel, which was the best thing we could have done. The staff were amazing, their recommendations were perfect for both dinner and day activities, especially Aykut's recommendation for our special dinner out. As for the hotel, the location is great, the breakfasts were out of this world and the room was lovely, we could not have wanted for more. I would recommend booking this hotel, and then arranging everything else once you arrive . .

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in great location, with every detail considered”
Reviews.Author: bella_oes1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Executive Penthouse Suite at the Witt Suites in early December and have booked again to return this year. Not sure how I forgot to leave a review for such an amazing hotel, but better late than never. The top floor penthouse is absolutely fabulous. It has a wrap around balcony with deck chairs and a dining setting for late night drinks and relaxing (whilst watching the sunset over the Bosphoros and call to prayer) or morning breakfast in the sunshine. The size is huge by any standard. The bed - a super king - is so big you could get lost in it. It is incredibly comfortable too, with fresh crisp white sheets. The decor is fantastic - think scandanavian/swedish uber trendy design in high quality finishes. Everything has been thought of in the room for your comfort and enjoyment. Even an evening snack which is brought in when the rooms are made up for you. The minibar is very well stocked and reasonably priced, though there is a supermarket just a block away and loads of cafes and eateries nearby. The breakfast is great, ordered the night before and delivered for you to enjoy in your room (or you can have it downstairs if preferred). We have had 2 sets of friends stay in a sea view suite and they said these were also extremely large and appointed with the same top quality finishes and thoroughly enjoyed it. On our last night, we had to change to the other penthouse (slightly smaller and cheaper) as the one we had been staying in was pre-booked. This too was fantastic with a large balcony and great pressure shower. We certainly weren't dissapointed. Location-wise the hotel is a short walk to taxim and all the bustling activity (around 10 or 12 minutes). It is a very short walk downhill to the main road with tram stop which takes you anywhere - Sultanahmet, Istiklal etc (between 5-7 minutes). Only word of warning is if you try and walk back up the hill, it is a significant incline-so we were always exhausted by that stage of the day and took a cab. I would recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of staying in Istanbul. The outlook from the rooms is very mystical, particularly at dusk. We always stayed on the balcony enjoying the sunset, then headed out for a later meal. The hotel is so good, you need to make a conscious effort to leave. Fortunately in Istanbul there is no shortage of amazing places to visit, so this makes it a little easier. I would certainly recommend this over staying in the more touristy areas, such as Sultanahmet. It is much nicer to be able to head out there for a day of site seeing them return 'home' where the restaurants nearby and setting is much more authentic and less gymicky. We've not found a hotel like this elsewhere and are planning to return for a relaxing stay at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “This is a stunningly good hotel with fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: ahmetfuat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Istanbul for a pampering weekend. From the minute we walked into this hotel we were hugely impressed. The staff, Aykut, Onur and Mehmet and everyone else were amazingly friendly and helpful. Our room (suite 52) was stunning with one of the best views from a hotel room we have experienced - looking over the Bosphorus to Topkapi palace, the Blue mosque and the Galata tower nearby. Most of the sights were within easy reach by tram or taxi. Nothing was too much trouble to the staff and we will definitely stay here next time we visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: catraveller999
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights after our cruise ended at Istanbul. Beyond its convenient location in Cihangir and next to Beyoglu, it's just a few minutes from the cruise terminal and Istanbul Modern. Delightful in every respect. The web site photos don't lie in terms of the incredible design. What the photos don't convey is the serene sense of comfort you experience as you enter the lobby. Nor does the web site convey the superb staff. Every single person was gracious, thoughtful, helpful and just plain NICE. Our room was perfect. If you've ever been in a hotel room with obtuse lighting, you'll love the Witt. I fell in love with the rain cloud shower, and appreciated the Bose iPod player. I was glad I emailed the hotel about transit from the cruise terminal. Their advice was spot on. The taxis at the cruise terminal run a racket - fixed fares, off meter. They quote a "standard" rate double to triple the meter. The hotel advised the appropriate rate and we refused to pay more. The dispatcher conceded when we said we'd call the hotel to send a taxi. Let the front desk call you a taxi - no matter where you're going. The taxis came almost immediately, were spotlessly clean, the driver ran the meter and drove sensibly. The front desk can help with almost any question, and has an encyclopedic reference binder on restaurants. Loved the free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: attmsw
Reviews.Content: Well situated near the Galata Tower and Museum of Modern Art, this trendy, beautiful, well located hotel is a gem. From the friendly staff, the beautifully appointed and immaculate rooms, the high speed apple computer, to the elegant breakfasts, this hotel is a standout! Although I usually prefer a hotel with a gym,If I come back to Istanbul I would not stay anyplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel in central istanbul”
Reviews.Author: foodie978
Reviews.Content: We loved the Witt Istanbul suites, the hotel is located in a quieter area of istanbul and yet its very close to the center where you will find all the restaurantsm shops and bars, The rooms are gorgeous and so spacious, i loved the bathrooms in particular. It is worth paying an extra supplement for the rooms with a view of the bosphurus, the view is really gorgeous! Just one word of advice; keep the hotel address with you at all times as the taxi drivers we had did not know where the hotel was and did not seem particularly helpful or maybe we were just unlucky.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel, wouldn't stay anywhere else....”
Reviews.Author: Rachel085
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels we've stayed in and we have stayed in some top class hotels! We had a corner room which was huge with 4 small balconies. The decor was modern, but fabulous and with everything you needed. Loved the mini chocolate muffins that were left everyday. I can't praise the staff enough as they were so helpful. I will definitely be running back as it was fabulous!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable in every way”
Reviews.Author: kquail
Reviews.Content: The service was friendly and helpful. The staff instinctively knew what we were after and made recommendations to restaurants and nightclubs that we would never have known about from guidebooks or the internet. The rooms were sleek and modern but embraced the the local feel. The location was quiet and had the feel of a neighborhood not the tourist-trap feel of the area around the Blue Mosque. However it was close to Istanbul's efficient public transportation network which quickly took us anywhere we wanted to go. Situated on a hill overlooking the Bosporus, the views of the Golden Horn, especially from the higher floors (4th - 6th), were probably the most breathtaking in the city. The soundproofing on the rooms kept out any noise from the streets and minimized the decibel level of the morning call to prayer. The morning continental breakfast was superb and included with the price of the room. The one drawback was that the hotel has a business center in the basement where it could have opted for a fitness center. We were able to make a 'deal' with a gym a few blocks away, but it would have been more beneficial if the local hotels had a standing agreement to let guests use it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: yyzprg
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to Istanbul and this hotel was my favourite so far. We loved the location and local area: good food options nearby and nice having grocery store and convenience store very close-by. As noted by others, the walk up from the tram stop is very steep but taxis are very reasonable and usually trust-worthy. The staff were great making us feel very comfortable from beginning to end. The concierge made all of our dinner reservations and was most helpful. The room (seaview) was great. We had three french balconies with 180 degree views of strait, Old Istanbul (all 3 big mosques, Topkapi..). Air conditioning worked very well and it was viciously hot. Pictures are very accurate and shower was particularly good. So nice to have a larger space to relax in after touring around in the extreme heat. Had a couple nice meals out - 360 was fine with great views and space & Angelique was one of best dinner experiences we've had anywhere. Food, scenery, crowd, space...all top-notch. Would definitely stay there again. Nice staying in a funky residential area with so much close-by at night. Room truly was one of best we've had anywhere. Can't think of anything negative to say at all.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Architect_SP
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels i have ever stayed ! Overall the decor is really nice , the room i stayed was huge with a nice view and 4 little balconies. The location is very nice because you have lots of restaurants , bars and night life very nearby , but the hotel street itself is calm and quiet. What was really fantastic was the staff , they were perfect , starting by the time of the reservation, they quickly answered to me with the confirmation, and airport transfer ( that worked really well by the way.) . Then i asked the concierge to make many reservations for me, and also this was made perfectly, besides his own suggestions that were very interesting. People from breakfast and front desk were extremely helfull, everyday , they call the taxis , explained to all of them were we were going etc... ( because most of the drivers did not speak english ), and above all they are all very nice , very helpfull with a smile on there faces. The hotel make you really feel at home . Definitely would stay again and would recomend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel and service. Amazing high...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Terrific hotel and service. Amazing high tech rooms. I loved the bed, the shower, the breakfast and the decor overall. They happily brought ice for my bad knee at all hours and asked how I was every time we went back to the hotel. If I was being picky I would prefer a hairdryer not attached to the bathroom wall. I bet if I'd asked they would have arranged that too! Overall it's high quality at a great cost and in a good neighbourhood for nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Fabulous and I can only repeat Fabulous"”
Reviews.Author: MarrakchiaBritgirl
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed at the Witt for the second time in August. It was a special birthday gift for her as we loved it so much the first time. We do not often return to places as there are so many to visit around the world but I am already planning my third visit for December. This hotel offers a stylish sleek environment that does not lose the cosy personal feel in the process. The staff are outstanding, helpful, informative and always on hand to help out with anything. The owners Secil and Tuncel are delightful and really brilliant at making suggestions on where to go and what to do without being intrusive. The breakfast is varied and delicious and a great start to the day in this incredible city and the suite we had was unbelievably spacious, stylish and a pleasure to return to at the end of each hectic packed day. I would not stay anywhere else even if you paid me! The price of the rooms are incredibly good value and you won't find better anywhere. The area is a hip happening place if you walk up a little hill for about 5 minutes and this is great when you have picky teenagers. Every little detail is carefully thought out to make the stay of the guest more comfortable and more memorable. I can't wait to return.....we are counting the days. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation......it is a calm oasis of tranquility and style in a buzzing city that stays awake 24 hours!

Reviews.Title: “Best room in the city if hill not a problem”
Reviews.Author: springtravel2006
Reviews.Content: Our room on the third floor had 4 windows and a view. The room was huge, well appointed and extremely comfortable. Breakfast in the lobby is delicious, with a good buffet selection, freshly squeezed oj, and even eggs cooked to order if you wish. Everyone on the staff is extremely helpfpul. Aykut speaks excellent English and seemed to always be there, but all the staff is superb. If they call a cab for you, they walk out and give the driver directions. They are happy to call for your restaurant reservations. I love boutique hotels, and this is a gem among them. I like being in an area away from the tourists and noise. The hotel has one weakness, and that is the very steep walk from the tram to the hotel. While we found it very easy to go down, the climb at the end of a day of touring was challenging. We should have taken cabs back to eliminate the problem, as they are reasonably priced. We were so happy to stay there, I would recommend it highly if you get around the steep streets issue.

Reviews.Title: “not as good as expected”
Reviews.Author: breeze1024
Reviews.Content: The layout and the view of the room is not as good as expected. The sea-view suite we got did not look like the one on their official web page (Maybe we got an "inferior" sea view suite.). One of the window was completely blocked by another building, and the arrangement of the other window was not ideal either (please refer to the photos). I need to walk toward the other window in order to see the view. While resting on the sofa or bed, I always saw the window that was blocked. Also, the location of the hotel is not ideal. The steep slope that everyone was complaining about is really steep. One day we hopped on a cab and showed him the name card that the hotel prepared for us, but the driver still could not find the right direction to the hotel. We had to instruct the driver and then got off once we could recognize the street (There were a lot of one-ways in that area).

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother going anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Eerik
Reviews.Content: If hotel could be home Witt Istanbul would be top of my list. We enjoyed our four days holiday in Istanbul. The city, full of glorious history, stunning monuments, good food and friendly people (except few taxi drivers) is a marvellous place for a holiday as such but as a hotel traveller I was very pleased that we decided to stay at Witt. Our room, with a corner glass view towards old town monuments was large and stylish with a really nice bathroom. The staff was always more than helpful. We were pampered! Thank You. Would I recommend? Certainly !!!

Reviews.Title: “An utterly stylish hotel with really friendly service - we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: KatjushaM
Reviews.Content: We spent part of our honeymoon in this hotel and could not have chosen a better place. The Witt Istanbul is a lovely little hotel that is styled right through to the background music playing in the lobby. You cannot but feel soothed by the sleek elegance of the room: great bathroom, comfy bed, stylish living-room area - they even gave us a complimentary chocoloate fondue. The hotel offers a nice breakfast in the room or as buffet, free internet access and a DVD collection for you to choose from and take up to your room. The staff are really friendly and trying very hard to be helpful, though some succeeded at this much more than others (Onur's advice was always spot-on - thank you, Onur!). The hotel is located within walking distance to the Taksim restaurant/bar quarter and very close to a tram station so that you can reach the Sultanahmet area or the bazaars very easily. If you're in reasonably good shape, the hill won't be a problem, as this takes only a few minutes to climb. The one improvement I would suggest is that the hotel try to accommodate the environment-lovers a bit more by offering an optional change of towels or bed linen and by recycling plastic or glass bottles.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: HomeAgainGoneAgain
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Witt Istanbul. The staff is the best, especially Aykut and Emrah at the desk. Not only did they help us with our stay at the hotel, but they went out of their way to find bus/ferry schedules for day trips and gave us great tips on restaurants. The rooms are extremely spacious and we had a great view of the city. The hotel is within walking distance of Taksim Square and the shopping district with great restaurants as well as the tram to get to the Golden Horn. I highly recommend the Witt to anyone staying in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Chices ApartmentHotel mit cityblick”
Reviews.Author: fritzschwinn
Reviews.Content: Chices Apartmenthotel oberhalb des Huegels Pophane im trendigen Viertel Chiangir. alles was das kleine luxusherz begehrt, Flachbildfernseher , grosse Betten, Badezimmer mit Molton Browne Produkten. Super Blick auf die Altstadt. nicht ganz billig aber sein Geld wert.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel. Great design, really...”
Reviews.Author: apk_brit
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel. Great design, really spacious rooms, very good value. Very well located if you like to walk - near Beyoglu / Taksim / Istiklal Cd, while off the beaten tourism path - more of an insight into true istanbullite life. Service really friendly, great breakfast. Only downside - limited amenities but still amazing value.

Reviews.Title: “great location friendly service”
Reviews.Author: europeanadventures
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the witt suites for 5 nights and were very impressed with the suites. after a long flight from Australia the showers were amazing! the hotel staff were extremely friendly booking taxis and restaurants each night for us. the hotel is located in a great area, whilst away from the key touristy area it is a short walk to some great sites of Istanbul. the suite even had a kitchenette, although with such great eating options close by it was something we didn't need to use. would recommend to any traveler who likes a boutique style accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: XXNYC
Reviews.Content: We just spent 10 days at the Witt and I strongly recommend it. It is is a great location - centrally located in an interesting, non-touristy location. Great restaurants within walking distance. It is very near a tram stop that is very easy to use and a short ride to all the major sites. Yes, there is the hill to walk up - but I would not let that keep you from staying at the Witt. If you don't want to walk up the hill, taxis are inexpensive in Istanbul. The room is big, the shower is wonderful, and the breakfast is great. However, the best thing about the Witt is all the fantastic people who work there. They are very helpful and friendly and make staying there a real pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Divine Area”
Reviews.Author: CyndifSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Witt Suites for 3 nights from the 12th to the 15th June. We had already spent 3 nights in Istanbul at the Hilton a week earlier and we enjoyed the Witt very much for a number of reasons. First of all the rooms were large and comfortable, internet was included as part of the room rate, the breakfasts were delcious and the location was fantastic. Not only was it very central to all the places I wanted to visit like the Istanbul Modern museum, the Pera and the Dorgancay museum but we loved being local. We could meander the narrow streets of Cihangir and enjoy the atmosphere, a quick wal to Istekal and Taksim square and two tram stops to Eminou. I can thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to experience the real aarty and bohemian part of istanbul. Also close to great restuarants. You can do most things on foot form the Witt suites.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: soozy2
Reviews.Content: We thought that this hotel was AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING. Recommend it fully to anyone who wants to stay in central Istanbul.
