It is an easy walk (downhill) to the tram which within 5 minutes will take you to old Istanbul with the spice markets, bazaars, and mosques (note on the way back from the tram there is a steep hill to walk up although there are these types of hills a lot in Istanbul going from old town to new town). The hotel is only a 10 minute walk to the new Istanbul where all the good bars and restuarants are too. The road the hotel is on is not the prettiest, however a short walk up it takes you to some really nice little cafes/bars. The hotel itself is gorgeous - it has a real 'boutique' feel. Look forward to the lift in the hotel its cool. The rooms are really big and we think that the pictures on some of the travel websites don't do them justice. The huge bed is so luxorious, thre is an ipod system, TV with all channels, and the most amazing shower! Quite literally the best shower expereince ever (the molton brown shower gel and hand cream is a lovely touch!). The hotel upgraded us to the penthouse suite for our final night there as it was our honeymoon, which was very sweet. The penthouse is unbelievable - just the view. Floor to ceiling windows along two walls and a wrap around balcony make it a very special place to watch the sun set over Istanbul. Apart from the balcony, which makes the penthouse well worth staying in, we thought our suite was probably a nicer room and interestingly the shower in the penthouse suite wasn't a patch on the one in our suite. Finally, the staff at Witt Istanbul Suites are amazing - really sweet, helpful and friendly. Aykut and Onur offered us lots of advice on where to go, were really friendly and chatty but also really professional. We look forwrd to staying here again sometime in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel -- great service, style and location”
Reviews.Author: triptaker002
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Witt Hotel in early June and it was great. The location was beautiful, we had a view of the Bosphorus, the service was impeccable and the place is very nicely designed. Very stylish with interesting and great touches such as the painting at the back of the elevator. Their breakfast was delicious. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I lived here.. or at least wish there were more of these in the world.”
Reviews.Author: miellen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Witt for 4 nights as part of my honeymoon and this is hands down the BEST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED AT in my entire life. From the location to the decor to the staff to the service, the showers, the breakfast... everything was incredible. After seeing its website I had been highly anticipating our stay - usually such high expectations aren't good but the Witt actually exceeded our expectations. I will definitely be back if I'm in Istanbul again. The only negative thing I would have to say, is that it's on a very steep road if you're coming from Tophane tram station. It's about a 2 minute walk up. If you don't want to hack it, do what we did and hail a cab for 2.5 lira from the bottom of the road :P I'm not posting any of my own pictures because the ones on their website are what the rooms really look like. http://www.wittistanbul.com

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hideaway, top quality, and well placed for the sights.”
Reviews.Author: hianshodan
Reviews.Content: Witt Istanbul Suites is very well hidden, tucked away in a sidestreet, between Taksim Square and the Galata Bridge which leads you to the tourist spots. We arrived in Taksim late in the evening in a thunderstorm (yes it does rain sometimes!), and got lost trying to find the Witt. We did eventually find it, thanks to 2 friendly police officers, who took pity on our bedraggled appearance, and gave us a lift. The apartments are on 6 floors (get the top floor if possible for a view over the Bosphorus), and we were on the 4th. It was open and spacious, and had a small balcony, which if you opened the double doors, gave an excellent view over the city. There is no cooking facilities, just a microwave, fridge, and sink, with an assortment of cutlery & crockery. The bathroom was roomy, and the shower had 2 settings (single head standard, and multi-head on the ceiling). Breakfast was from 7.00 - 11.00, so plenty of time to get over the 2 hour difference, and was buffet style, with a turkish slant - very nice. Top tip is to get the Bosphorus ferry, which takes you from west to east and back several times, travelling the length of the Bosphorus, and ending just at the mouth of the Black Sea, on the east side. The ferry waits there 2 hours, giving you time to walk around, or eat (not enough time for both), and then retraces it's steps. All for 25 Lira (about Â£11). Otherwise, if you get the "Bosphorus Cruise" for 10 Lira, it only takes you 1/3 of the way up, and doesn't stop - avoid it at all costs. We visited Topkapi Palace (visiting the Harem is a must), and the Blue Mosque (which is free). Don't take the open top bus tour, as the commentary is poor, and the experience is not good value for money. Evenings walking along the pedestrianised Istiklal Caddesi were great, with so many sidestreets off, containing bars & restaurants. We were spoiled for choice. Altogether an excellent visit, and we would certainly stay at the Witt, should we find ourselves in Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous design hotel with Bosphorus view”
Reviews.Author: genious44
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well designed, the rooms are big and beautiful especially the bathrooms. Fantastic view over Istanbul and the Bosphorus. The personal is very nice and helpfull. Good breakfast buffet. Location in the middle of the city

Reviews.Title: “Modern, hip hotel with trendy decor, friendly and professional service”
Reviews.Author: SteveandRosie
Reviews.Content: We had 4 nights at the Witt and stayed again for a night when we returned to Istanbul. Aykut and Jan, in particular, were very friendly and helpful and contributed to a memorable stay in Istanbul. The beds are fantastic and the rooms stylish and comfortable. Location was great for sightseeing and nightlife. Would recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “What a treat, you couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: zmanderson
Reviews.Content: We stayed the first 3 nights in Istanbul on the Sultanahmet side, which was nice because it was close to the sights, but for our last night I wanted to stay somewhere nice. We were not disappointed. This place is immaculately decorated and you feel instantly relaxed when you walk through the front door. The room blew our mind away, it was huge and had everything you could wish for. The shower is also amazing with the most impressive shower head we have ever seen, perfect for massaging away tiredness from the day sightseeing. We requested our breakfast in our room and the spread was delicious. I wanted to stay there longer and it was a shame we didn't stay their longer.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, quiet, boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: MajicM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently with friends and loved the hotel. The rooms are spacious, well appointed and quiet with great showers! We loved the modern elegant decor and the staff were friendly and helpful. It is in a quiet street close to Beyoglu's attractions. As there are only 16 rooms the place never feels crowded. Coffee machines in each room were a treat and the breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: CityBreak84
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful 4 night stay at Witt Istanbul Suites. Had booked a sea view suite but we were upgraded to the terrace suite so we had our own balcony. Breakfast was served on the balcony up until 11am. Large, comfortable bed. Great bathroom with incredible shower. Airport transfer was 45 euros for pick up, 25 euro return. Location was great as tram into old city only 3 min walk away - down a very steep slope - which always seemed longer on the way up! Only minor quibble was the lift call button - quite loud and disruptive in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel rocks! - how to love istanbul? - stay at the witt...”
Reviews.Author: Riddyralf
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel made me want to come back to Istanbul, but only if I am booked into the Witt. We stayed in two dirrefent rooms due to us mucking around with our bbooking and both the normal suite and the penthouse were fabulous! Pennthouse equals amazing views and well just amazing views to take your breath away - I didnt even notice the room, I think it was the similar to our other room which was design tastic, with mirrors and black beautiful tiles and a wonderful kitchen marble business going on in the middle, lovely shower and comfy bed. Breakfast was perfect, understated, delicious and easy. The staff however, and their recommendations were what elevates this hotel to best in istanbul as they are spot on and very friendly. Love love the Witt.

Reviews.Title: “friendly, comfortable stay with style”
Reviews.Author: NazanVK
Reviews.Content: My husband, my 2 children aged 8 &9 & I stayed here for a week in October/November. It was the best hotel that we stayed in whilst in Turkey, & in particular, Istanbul, during our one month trip around the country. We stayed at some hotels that were rated 5 star during this time. I would have to say that none of these compared to the quality provided by the Witt. The rooms were extremely spacious, modern, beautifully appointed, & very clean. We were able to have 2 roll our beds for the kids & still have lots of room to move in despite luggage for 4 people. There is a sitting area with a couch, coffee table & satellite TV. The kitchenette is well equipped with a microwave, fridge, crockery, coffee maker, kettle etc. Wonderful for a family. The bathrooms were spacious, with stunning appointments & extremely clean. The Molton Brown soap & lotions were luxurious. We stayed in both city view & sea view suites. Both were lovely & comfortable; however, if you can book a sea view one, do so as the view is well worth it . The staff were wonderful. Nothing was too hard for them. Upon my return to Istanbul, I had severely injured myself on the tour bus steps (a ruptured achilles tendon, but that's another story !!) & had difficulty walking. I thought that my 1 week stay in Istanbul was going to be a disaster. However, the concerned hotel manager very kindly arranged for a wheel chair & crutches to be provided for my use throughout our stay - at no cost !! I also was very impressed that after a day of major shopping, upon our request the management provided us with every imaginable packing material (again, at no cost) so that we could post a large parcel back home. I am sure that they would have mailed it for us if we had asked, but we had relations there who did this for us. There is not a restaurant serving meals at all times, but you can have a buffet breakfast downstairs or place an order & have it delivered to your room. We did the latter most of the time as my children (after an arduous tour of the country) were keen to lounge in our comfortable room & take advantage of the satellite TV which, though initially difficult to navigate, was relatively easy after assistance by one of the patient staff. The breakfast was very substantial, though at times we couldn't predict what would or would not arrive as part of our order. Some nights after sight seeing my children were too tired to go out.for dinner. The concierge had a myriad of menus from nearby restaurants from which we could select a delicious meal at reasonable cost which was promptly delivered to us. When I wanted to arrange an afternoon tea at the hotel for my relations, the manager quickly organised for top quality baklava & cookies to be brought in AT COST & set up a lovely private sitting area downstairs with tea & coffee service provided attentively. The kind & friendly personal attention & service that we received at this hotel was wonderful. Our experience could have been tarnished due to my serious injury if not for the amazing support provided by the staff. Further, unlike some hotels around Turkey, even those rated 5 star, the staff can speak perfect English . They were helpful in arranging taxis for us. One problem that we faced was that upon our return, it was difficult for taxis to find their way back. I found that it was easier if you told them that it was near the German & Italian hospitals. Otherwise, you may need to download a map from the internet & keep it with you. I am sure the staff wouldn't mind helping with this. There also is very little parking available which caused some problems when visitors arrived to see us. The only quibble that I had with the hotel was that come November, the heating was put on full blast. Prior to that, the airconditioning had been excellent (which is a rare thing in Turkey). My husband called management when we awoke roasting in our beds at 1 am. Upon our request, the heating was turned down for a short while. However, it was put back on full blast within a couple of hours and again we sweated terribly. My children even awoke & had to take off their PJs. We eventually opened the windows. However, be warned, the hotel is near to a couple of mosques & the duelling calls to prayer boom through the room when the windows are open. (We love the call to prayer, but sleep is important, too. ) Otherwise, the hotel rooms themselves are very quiet. & you would never know that anyone else was staying there. The hotel is located near Taksim & Beyoglu, just a short walk from Istiklal Road. There are some hilly areas, so be warned - get a cab if needed. If you want to see the 'Old City', it is only a short inexpensive taxi ride there. There are many little local stores where you can buy soft drinks & the like if you should need to This is a top hotel - a real find - & I thank tripadvisor for providing the information which led to my reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller555
Reviews.Content: We went to Istanbul for 5 days in a business trip and the Hotel is great. The customer service is excellent. They gave us the suite with a terrace on the 6h floor and it has a great view..... The hotel is recommended by Mr. & Mrs. Smith and yeah they are right! Very nice recommendation..... People that work there want to give you the best at all times. Quite frankly this is the type of a boutique hotel that I like to go for business/pleasure trips. Only 16 rooms, nicely appointed, nice ambiance and very quiet. For those that know how rooms are in Istanbul these is the best alternative even to any of the Marmara Hotels..... We had a great time! Congrats Witt Istanbul...

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: dokomo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for one night and we were thrilled with the service and the room quality! We had booked a city view room and upon request they upgraded us to the sea view room without hesitation. The rooms are spacious and if you book a sea view room the view is sensational! The hotel is perfectly located on a quieter street in Beyoglu, a very trendy neighborhood on the European side of Istanbul. Bars and restaurants are minutes away. Istiklal Caddesi, the oxford street of Istanbul, is a mere 10 minute walk. The tram station is at a 3 minute walk. The tram takes you directly to old town where all the sight seeing is. This hotel is perfect for those who prefer living in smaller hotels which offer a more homely feel with the advantage of a brilliant location and view!

Reviews.Title: “very cool spot in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: SuffolkLizzie
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Istanbul and we were so excited about our stay at Witt. The staff were extremely helpful and kind. The rooms were amazing. We stayed in a City Suite which was very cool, modern, clean, lots of little touches that made it very special. We also spent a night in the penthouse, which although not such a good layout as the City suite, lacking the very cool kitchen (although totally unnecessary) and the bathroom not so good, the views made up for that. With a terrace and incredible views over Istanbul, it would probably be hard to find a better spot in town.

Reviews.Title: “Third time at the Witt and just as good as the first time”
Reviews.Author: starjohnday
Reviews.Content: What can I possibly say that has not been already said. I stay at this hotel (3rd time in 18 months) not only for the overall environment but for the level of service that I recieve for example I could not use the hotel computer in the lobby because the software would not accept a specific download from my company, spoke to reception to see if there was anything they could do and they provided me with a laptop (that had compatable software) that they had spare that I could use in my room. Excellant service from the reception and breakfast staff. Nothing seemed to be too much trouble for anybody. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wounderful Witt”
Reviews.Author: MariaochJon
Reviews.Content: We had the best stay ever at the Witt....we hardly wanted to leave the hotel at all for all the comfort and the very attentive and amazing staff. They were the most helpful and accommodating when we had problems going home for the volcanoâ€¦really did everything they could to help us out. The hotel has the perfect location and feels luxurious yet intimate and homely at the same time. Everything was so pretty and nice, the furniture, the washing bagâ€¦coffee cups, everything. All that amazing cheese for breakfastâ€¦.and the to die for showerâ€¦what can I say, we will be back for sure! Did I mention it was our honey moon..

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed a lot this stylish and cosy hotel ideally located in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: rousselshanghai
Reviews.Content: Great Small Hotel in a quite and perfect location For Tourism In Istanbul. Vincinity Of Taksim's Metro And Tophane's Tram Makes Every Place In Istanbul Easy To Go To. The Hotel Is Well Decorated, Quite And Welcoming, The Staff Is Nice, Effective And Discrete."

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: wittfan2
Reviews.Content: Looking for a very pleasant hotel? The Witt Istanbul was excellent. Central for most good restaurants and sightseeing. The very friendly staff is helpful with directions and happy to book you a table in popular restaurants. Simple but delicious and complete breakfast in the stylish lobby or in bed. The bed is amazing, firm but very very good. From the amazing bed to the amazing five head rain shower (sorry for spoiling water). All that in a beautiful designed spacious room (around 60m2). Design by Autoban, also responsable for the design of many nice restaurants. So a suite for the price of a room. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: DoctorPaulLondon
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Witt over Easter and absolutely loved our stay. We were lucky enough to book the penthouse suite and the views over the Bosphorus and city were absolutely stunning. Having breakfast each morning on our own private terrace with that amazing view was an unforgettable way to start each day. The room was very spacious with floor to ceiling windows to take in the amazing vista. We also loved the way the room was furnished. Very funky but also very comfortable as well. The staff were very helpful and provided some great recommendations for dinner. The hotel booked dinner for us at late notice at two really popular restaurants but we still managed to get almost the best table in the house on both occasions. I would particularly recommend 5 Kat which was a short walk towards Taksim square and almost had as good a view as Witt Suites. The location of the hotel is great, walking distance to lots of restaurants and bars in the local area and also close to Taksim Square. The hotel also arranged return transfers from the airport that were competitively priced. All in all loved the stay and hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: DJGSydney
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Witt Istanbul Suites for five nights after having been in the Sultanahmet area for the previous week. What a pleasure it was here from the word go. Our room was lovely - very large, well appointed with a very comfortable bed and of course the six head shower. It was very handy also having the kitchenette which was well stocked with good quality crockery and glassware and everything else you need for a casual dinner in! For our last night we were upgraded to the penthouse. The wrap around terrace from the penthouse had a 180 degree view over Istanbul and naturally was spectacular. We really enjoyed our last night here, but were equally happy in our original room. As in previous comments all the staff at the hotel were extremely efficent and very friendly and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. The location was also good. Even though it isn't right in the centre of things we thought that this was actually a plus as it meant that it was quiet. But a 5-8 minute walk and you're right in the thick of things. We travel a lot and both agree that this is one of the better hotels we have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel. Modern design, great staff and great location.”
Reviews.Author: mirasi
Reviews.Content: Witt Istanbul Suites was a great choice. The staff was helpfull. They made all our restaurant arrangements and their recommendations were great. They gave us good advise regarding transportation, shopping, sight seeing, etc. The hotel is small and has only the basic services; but their standards are high and quality is great. Murat and all the other staff were always very attentive and helpfull. Location was also great. The hotel is located near the tram station and near Taksim square, making access to the old part of town (Sultanahmet) and to the modern part fantastic. Great hotel from which to explore Istanbul. The suites were large enough to accomodate two adults and two children (with extra beds for each child).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for young people”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkWendy
Reviews.Content: We had a terrific 5 day stay at the Witt. The staff is charming and terrific 99% of the time. One day our room wasn't cleaned and our airport pick up was botched, but the room was fabulous (Room 52 seems the best choice for the view), the breakfast ample and interesting, and the staff couldn't be more hospitable. However I would recommend that anyone with difficulty walking steep or broken sidewalks reconsider staying here. Unless you're prepared to taxi everywhere and back, there's a difficult climb no matter where you need to go. The modern design of the furniture is also somewhat less than comfortable, though the bed is wonderful. The chairs are not for anyone with a back problem. So for the young who don't mind hard surfaces and an occasional error by the staff, this is a special place.

Reviews.Title: “Calm, stylish hotel with a splash of luxury”
Reviews.Author: 82Cam
Reviews.Content: The Witt Suites is a very stylish hotel but maintains a warm and friendly atmosphere, all the staff are only too happy to assist you and make your arrangements as hassle-free as possible. The room was very well equipped with a kitchen area and lots of nice little touches like a fondue kit. The breakfast was fine, the options aren't huge but with only a few rooms I wouldn't have expected a massive spread as seen in the several hundred room hotels - the real bonus is that it runs until 11, perfect for lazy mornings! We were especially pleased that they arranged us a breakfast at 5.30am on the morning of our departure. One thing to bear in mind however is that access from the hotel to the public transport is a really steep but not very well paved road, so if you have walking difficulties it would be necessary to use cabs, which are plentiful enough. Location-wise there are lots of good restaurants and cafes nearby and it's close to the tram link. The hotel is lovely and calm as the city is so bustling and busy so makes a great place to head back to after a day's sightseeing. There's also a selection of recent DVD releases to watch in the room. I would recommend using the hotel's car for airport transfers - we used Ataturk airport but the taxi from there was terrifying and the driver didn't know where he was going, however the hotel's driver only cost 5 Lira more (approx Â£2.50) and drove more sensibly. The hotel will always be special as my boyfriend proposed in our room!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - in every sense of the word ...”
Reviews.Author: SFR6262E
Reviews.Content: After the rude taxi driver dropped us at the hotel, it was uphill from then on. Not just literally - as the hotel is located at a sloping undulating part of the Istanbul - but the service just got better and better. Upon arrival, AYKUT at the reception offered coffee and tea not just to us, but to our friends who were there waiting to check in to ANOTHER hotel nearby. And even helped to store their baggage for a few hours. AYKUT then patiently explained to us how to find our way around the winding streets of this part of Beyoglu, which are most confusing to a first time visitor to fabulous Istanbul, who is trying to experience the city beyond the confines of the tourist areas of Sultanahmet. The room is excellent, the 6 head rain shower is unmatchable. The breakfast (either in the lobby or the wheeled into your room upon request) was simply sumptuous. And the staff is extremely honest - I had accidentally left my credit card after payment at the desk, but was informed of it by email as soon as I was home some 18 hours later. Thanks, Onur KARA ! The only complaint is that the gym and terrace with a view shown in many booking sites are now accessible only to guests of the newly converted suites. Well, too bad - maybe next time ...

Reviews.Title: “book it if you can”
Reviews.Author: iantobedfordUK
Reviews.Content: just come back from a 4 night stay at the Witt, excellent hotel. Rooms are large, well equipped with microwave, fridge, kettle, cutlery, crockery, glasses etc. Very clean, great 6 head shower, just what is needed after slogging round the hills of Istanbul all day !. Staff are excellent and very helpful, Aykut on reception gets a special mention for his friendly advice and helpfulness. Breakfast at the hotel we found really good, continental style but a couple of hot dishes as well, more then enough to start the day. Location is good but there is a steep climb up from the tramway (about 300 yds away), Taksim square is about 10 mins walk, again uphill (but then everything is in Istanbul). Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Turks have mastered Boutique Hotels like no others have done”
Reviews.Author: AlmondWater
Reviews.Content: The hotel is family owned. The pros: - The rooms: HIP, clean, spacious. - Good breakfast. - The location: on a hill between a Tramstation and Taksim Square. Things to look out for: - The Nespresso Machine Coffee costs 5 Euros per shot. - When its windy, something on the window flaps, which creates noise.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated Hotel, Team and location! Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: bronnieg
Reviews.Content: I had read about this hotel and took the plunge, visiting Turkey with a friend for the first time. I was, I admit ,somewhat apprehensive having not visited Istanbul before, I need not have worried. All my fears were allayed at check in. From the moment I entered the Witt I was made to feel so welcome and looked after by the reception staff. Nothing was too much trouble and I must give Murat a special mention for the lengths he went to make us feel secure. The setting, ambience, rooms and tailor made service is second to none. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “DIVINE STAY AT THE WITT”
Reviews.Author: rehlein76
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real gem! Great Style. Wonerful location. Extremely quiet which is rare in Istanbul. Outstanding Service. Onut+Murat and the entire team were always helpful, friendly and attentive to our requests and questions. We will definitely return to the WITT which we consider to be one of the best city hotels in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: stiivie
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff & service, great place, great room, lovely designer furniture... all ingredients were there to make our short stay in Istanbul very confortable and enjoyable. Being Located on the limits of Beyoglu is much better than staying in the center where noise level at night is quite high. Historical/touristic center is only 30min walk but you may also take the tramway located just 200m down from the Witt. The suites are wery well equiped and furnished to make your stay at Witt as confortable as at home.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: madameswanLondon
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Witt Istanbul Suites last weekend for 2 nights after staying for 2 nights at the sorkeci konac and it was superb! if you are looking for a modern, clean, up to the moment trendy place this is it. it is very boutiquey not in an over the top kind of way but these guys have thought about everything, the room was amazing big, clean with all the mod cons..it had a little kitchenette in the middle fully equipped. the bathroom was great with the most amazing shower and great molton brown products..i can't say anything bad about this place..the staff were very helpful and efficient in a very friendly way..we felt we were at our sophisticated mate's house..book this fabulous hotel, the place to stay in istanbul..you will be happy there..it is near the touristy places and their shopping street a sort of oxford street..just go go go we loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and what a shower !”
Reviews.Author: FredAthens
Reviews.Content: What a find ! True boutique hotel - great design, rooms really spacious with well equipped kitchenette. Loved the shower and the taps (like chrome pebbles) - the only improvement I can think of is to supply a proper (designer) highdryer instead of the regular cheap hotel type. Hotel doesnt have restaurant so one evening staff organised a take-away for me from choice of menus - great idea - good food at logical prices..... Area a bit 'dodgy' for women alone so just take taxi ..... Staff extremely helful and nice .....

Reviews.Title: “istanbul”
Reviews.Author: nnikolas
Reviews.Content: contemporary and comfortably located (10 minute walk by feet from Taksim square) hotel big, well-equipped rooms, well designed poor breakfast, lacks something like a swimming pool

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, efficient, warm and comfortable all to be found in this wonderful design hotel”
Reviews.Author: CampbellMC
Reviews.Content: Thank you so much for ensuring our business trip to Istanbul worked smoothly. The staff were all extremely helpful. From the bar staff, to the driver, to housekeeping and reception. Impeccable service. This hip hotel is clean and trendily decorated although not at the expense of comfort. Aykut on the reception helped us when severe weather meant we were delayed and kindly organised drivers and food upon arrival, even though it was 1am by the time we arrived! Thank you Aykut. I can highly recommend the hotel chauffeur who negotiated the hilly Istanbul roads even with a thick layer of snow on the streets. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, with incredible rooms and service, I wondered how I could take this back to Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Wellbrook
Reviews.Content: The staff was fantastic, the location was excellent, I walked up to Taxim area at nite and felt safe, during day I walked over the bridge to tour the attractions around Sophia and Blue Mosque. (Sophia is a MUST see). The room was incredible, large, new, King bed with a great view, I luv the shower. I actually took photos of the room, the only other time I have done that is at the Venetian at Vegas. You definitely feel at home in the hotel. First time in Istanbul, but I will definitely stay here next time.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel in a lovely area within walking distance of several restaurants and not too touristy.”
Reviews.Author: WorcesterBunny1
Reviews.Content: The suites are beautiful and the staff can't do enough for you. Showers are heavenly! A perfect place to experience a bit of luxury and in a good place to get away from the more obviously tourist area of sultanhamet. Several lovely restaurants within walking distance and also very close to IStaklal street with lots of shops,cafes and bars. Easy to get to the tourist sites too.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing suite in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: oslo000
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel in a taxi after a 3 hour flight from Oslo. Taxi is the way to go from the airport to the hotel by the way. The hotel is located in the middle of a very steep street/hill, so unless you want to carry your suitcase up that hill... take a taxi. Friendly welcome at the front-desk, and was given a suite on a high floor as IÂ´d requested. The suite was just amazing. Big comfy bed, kitchen with all the necessary equipment, and a nespresso machine. Minibar was quite expensive, but buy what you need at the local supermarket up the street instead. Leather sofa, flat-screen TV, DVD-player, and a big bathroom. No tub though, but the shower compensate for that. ThereÂ´s no restaurant in the hotel, but theyÂ´ll get you whatever you want at any hour. Breakfast was served in the room, and was just amazing. The location of the hotel is very good. On the new side of Istanbul, not far from Taksim in a cosy and quiet neighborhood. If you follow the street up the hill youÂ´ll get to Taksim, down the hill to the tram that takes you to Sulthanamet, Grand Bazar and Hagia Sofia. Would definitely stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect design & service”
Reviews.Author: SamakaLondon
Reviews.Content: This Residence, with its homely chic, has been conceived with the right balance of youthful, contemporary yet classic arrangement of elements, so as to always feel delighted by its discovery yet at home and relaxed. The guys (and they all are young cool sexy men) who make the place tick, are all happy helpful, and charismatic. A must stay, I will def. be back, next time I promised myself the penthouse or at least a room with the sea view over the Bos.

Reviews.Title: “Great design hotel”
Reviews.Author: nikostsepetis
Reviews.Content: The idea behind is spectacular. You find an ordinary 70s building in chic location, near Taxim but not that too near to this crazy square, and you hire the best Turkish designers, Autoban (a must-do is to visit their shop in Pera) to turn it into a luxury suites hotel. The rooms are impeccable: function meets beauty in a way that could become a case-study for other hotels! The staff is very polite, the toiletries are from Molton Brown and the breakfast has quality (albeit nothing to shout about!!). The city is indeed spectacular, one of the great cities of the world but in my opinion with a great down-side (read below). Few suggestions: The restaurant recommendations need to be again very well thought-off. At the moment i write this review (on my 3d day) we have had only bad dinners. To be fair, only one tavern was recommended to us (Sofiyali 9) from the hotel and we went there on a new year eve BUT the food seems to be an issue in this great city, sorry guys but the food quality i had ranged from disgusting to medium!!!! I think that such a hotel should really try to find the best in restaurants, if possible in the vicinity, and warm the guests about the problematic food scene. And the guests should really do some homework before they come to Istanbul if they want to eat properly (and not pay a fortune). A small massage room would be a nice addition as the hotel, other than the great rooms, seem to not cater to the other needs that a modern traveller might have, such as some kind of spa facilities or a good restaurant or some nice in-hotel bar where locals would also frequent. Overall a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “definitely worth it”
Reviews.Author: roupap
Reviews.Content: we stayed in Dec. 2009 in witt istanbul suites and it was worth it. The room is very beautiful, the decoration is stylish, very clean, spacious and compfortable! The service provided lived up to our expectations, as the staff was friendly and ready to help us anytime. The location is central, not on the taxim square (which is better, because its noisy), but very close to it, walking distance from it and from the tram. I liked it and i will definitely go there again, when i visit Istanbul, which by the way, is a magical city, a combination of modern and traditional. People are friendly, having a good time going out and dancing, drinking, listening to music, and on the other hand you see everywhere the muslim element of living. In the bathroom, the shower is unique, because of its structure. We stayed on the 1st floor, so the view of the city was poor, but the inside of the hotel compensates for this, plus i dont think the view is very important parameter. Tipp: negotiate everything on the bazaar, these people love it, its in their blood, at the beginning i was feeling weird about negotiating a price, but they expect you to negotate, its weird if you dont do it! Last but not least, the hamam experience! Its a must, you see what im talking about, when you do it. Just look for trustworthy places. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Five Stars in Every Respect!”
Reviews.Author: koala37
Reviews.Content: We spent a fabulous long weekend here in early December. Regardless of what aspect you wish to comment on, this hotel is flawless. From our arrival we were greeted warmly and offered drinks and a chat regarding what we wanted to do that evening. The lobby/breakfast area is beautifully designed in modern decor but is warm and inviting. The staff - absolutely outstanding. Friendly, and knowledgable, we had some great restaurant experiences by describing exactly the type of place we felt like each evening. Location - many restaurants are within walking distance as is the main pedestrian street. A short downhill walk will get you to the tram stop - from here you are easily connected to the major tourist sites of Istanbul - minutes to the end of the tram line will take you to Dolmabahce Palace then travelling in the opposite direction you can get to the Mosques, Bazaars, etc. very easily and within minutes. It is extremely easy to navigate by following the tram lines if you choose to walk back to the hotel. Breakfast - fantastic assortment of cold buffet items as well as eggs if you wish to have a hot breakfast. One morning our waiter suggeted trying a typical Turkish breakfast item which I did, and was told the hotel manager had made it at home. It is these types of special touches which make the hotel so outstanding when compared to most hotels. The rooms - we found them incredibly spacious and great design features. Many reviewers commented on the shower and it was not disappointing - the best shower ever! Molton Brown products in the bathroom, the design of the shower, sinks and fixtures were gorgeous. The bed was comfortable, linens soft and there was a sizable sitting area with flat screen tv, kitchen and mini fridge for refreshments. We were quite impressed with the stock of in room refreshments including a bottle of Turkish wine that we enjoyed - prices were fairly reasonable as well. We had a truly memorable stay at the Witt - I honestly don't think we would have experienced as much of Istanbul staying at one of the typical five stars that we were considering before reading the reviews of the Witt. You will not be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Kursad Rocks, Oh and so does the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BringHomeTroops
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 10 nights. The place is gorgeous and looks like the Web site. It is one of the nicest places weâ€™ve ever stayed in. I love the little holes everywhere! The room was large with a comfy bed. It was surprisingly quiet given our room location. It was kept clean. The location was excellent for our activities. The best part about the place truly was the staff. Kursad, the F&B manager, was the best. He was accommodating, friendly and helpful. He is also quite funny. Honestly breakfast with him was a highlight each day. One example of why we love him - one day, our favorite breakfast item was not available and he sent someone out to a nearby bakery to get something that was close to the item not available. I was so astounded that he would go that much trouble. Who does that anymore? It was so thoughtful. He answered all of all questions and convinced us to take the cruise up the Bosphorous (How could we not - everyday he asked â€œHave you taken the cruise yet?â€�). Incidentally, I recommend that to everyone. The rest of the staff was friendly and accommodating as well. We enjoyed talking with everyone (thanks to Onor and Murat for answering all of our questions) and appreciated the opportunity to interact with everyone on a more personal level than we would have been able to at a larger hotel. Small items that could enhance the stay - more light for the bathroom mirror, a digital alarm clock, and a few complimentary bottles of inexpensive drinking water. Also soy milk at breakfast would have been nice for those who canâ€™t do dairy. I know they canâ€™t accommodate every special request, but just thought Iâ€™d mention it. And, curiously, there were no peepholes on the doors. I think this would just be a prudent safety measure. The only snag we hit was with a leak in our bathroom. The ceiling in our bathroom began leaking one evening. Of course at the time we did not know what exactly was leaking, the toilet? shower? sink? etc. Iâ€™ll spare you the details but letâ€™s say it really should have been handled much better. It did get fixed the next day. We were very surprised that we were never approached by a manager in the following days with an apology. We had to bring it up in the end to ask for a credit for a night (which was granted) but certainly felt we should not have had to inquire and an apology should have been proactively offered. By their collective response, it seemed as though the staff didnâ€™t think leaking sewage in our room was really much of an inconvenience for us. It really was. Perhaps it is just a cultural difference as we have been afforded a higher level service for much more minor issues at other establishments. Even with the snag, we would stay here again and would recommend it. The only unfortunate part for us is that Iâ€™m afraid with its popularity it will become too expensive for us. We booked at 149 Euros a night which was quite a bargain. The place really is gorgeous. You will love it.

Reviews.Title: “If it is Istanbul, it has to be the Witt.”
Reviews.Author: barca212
Reviews.Content: I booked the Witt after reading several of the excellent reviews on this site and I am so glad that I did. From the time I made the reservation till check out, the Witt experience was nothing short of spectacular. This hotel gets everything right - from design, amenities in the room, spacious rooms, breakfast, overall environment and most importantly the staff. You are made to feel at home from the moment you walk through the doors (and even earlier, if you order a pick-up service at the airport through the hotel). I was traveling with family and we had two rooms over 8 nights at the Witt. The hotel ended up feeling like home for us. Onur, Murat and Aykut at the reception are simply exceptional. They helped us with everything from restaurants and directions to experiencing local spots. Always a smile, always willing to help and extremely warm and friendly. After a long day, we we were always offered tea when we walked into the hotel. There is a great lounge area in the lobby with an eclectic collection of books and travel guides and several DVDs (for the room). The rooms are extremely large with the most amazing and comfortable beds and shower. Heated marble floors and six-head showers in the bathroom with amazing Molton Brown products are a fantastic touch! The kitchen area (fabulous marble island) is great - espresso machine, hot water pot and a great selection of items (many that you pay for, if you consume). The owner of the hotel, Tuncel, was also there during our stay. He was extremely generous with his time, regularly checked to make sure everything was fine with our stay and that we were having a good time, and provided us with several excellent suggestions - - restaurants, neighborhoods and shopping. The morning breakfast (included in the room rate) is fantastic - cheeses, cold cuts, cereals, baked goods, eggs made to order, juice, coffee/tea etc. Kursad, the gentleman who serves breakfast, was such a joy to get to know. He provided us with great service and it was a joy to talk to him every morning. The Witt was an absolute highlight of our stay in Istanbul. I know I will definitely be returning to this hotel as it is a true gem. Having stayed in several different hotels in numerous countries, the Witt easily ranks among the best. If you are planning a trip to Istanbul, look no further. Just book your stay at the Witt. You will not regret the decision.

Reviews.Title: “quite attractive”
Reviews.Author: Viajero-Alfa
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself were in this hotel from Monday November 9th to the 12th, when we left for Greece. Even though we arrived early, around 10:30 am., we got the room (just vacated by Spanish tourists) and, while waiting, we even got a welcome breakfast. From the very beginning we were pleased with the decoration, the quick response to questions and services, the cleanliness. The young men at the reception, the bar, the driver, the bedroom cleaners (Aykut and company) were very friendly and helpful. All in all we liked and enjoyed, the hotel and the city as well. Since we are not Europeans, perhaps they should charge fees to American visitors in dollars.

Reviews.Title: “friendly,relaxed,peaceful”
Reviews.Author: stavrosKardamili
Reviews.Content: Great,great,great... The staff are helpful and friendly..Stavros

Reviews.Title: “What a friendly, helpful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: rselip99
Reviews.Content: We spent just one night at the Witt but felt like we were treated like a regular customer. Rooms are huge, clean and everything they say they are. This hotel is a great value. We were unaware that we had arrived on Turkey's Independence Day(Replublic Day). When we asked for a recommendation for dinner the staff took over from there. We arrived at our restaurant to a window table with the best view of a spectacular fireworks display. Food was fantastic and, again we felt right at home.

Reviews.Title: “cosy and friendly gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: dia2009
Reviews.Content: we spent a week at the witt istanbul suites hotel and had a wonderful holiday in a most beautiful city- we enjoyed istanbul greatly and were very pleased with the choice of hotel.it is a small, well equiped modern hotel located within striking distance of all the attractions and yet away from the tourist area.although the hotel may be inconvenient for those who have a problem walking down a steep slope to the tram station or up a gentler though longer climb to the metro, i would recommend it strongly as the perfect little hotel in istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: KatieAberdeen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real oasis of peace near the heart of Istanbul with superb interior design throughout. The service was excellent before, during and after our trip with super friendly staff that helped with questions about local transport, restaurants etc.. Breakfast included a good range of cereal, fruit, croissants, pancakes etc. and the bar was open later in the day for a relaxing drink after a hard-days sightseeing. Would love to go back to Istanbul and spend more time and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A very stylish haven of calm enjoying magnificent views”
Reviews.Author: RJ-ontour
Reviews.Content: Having been to Istanbul many times before it was the first time we have stayed in the Cihangir district. We took the metro and tram to within 500 meters of the hotel and then walked the remainder up a steep hill, hence there is no need for a gym in the hotel !! This trip is very easy and takes about 50 minutes from the airport. (cost 3 YTL). The hotel is about 1 year old and is a real gem. The boutique style is really funky and different from many hotels in Istanbul, it has many modern design features and all the latest technology you could possibly need. The staff in reception are very helpful with extensive knowledge especially on restaurants and methods of transport around Istanbul and every member of staff without exception was polite, friendly and wanted to make our stay as easy and as enjoyable as possible. We were very fortunate to have been given the penthouse suite which was enormous with glass on two sides and an outside lounging area all around the room. The view was stunning right across to the Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque. You could watch all the ferry boats and also over to the Asian side. The bar area where the breakfast was served had an air of tranquility about it and the selection of food was a mixture of Turkish and more western styles, all being very fresh and tastefully presented. We will definitely stay there again and would recommend it highly for either business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is everything a boutique hotel should be..”
Reviews.Author: MYGLOBE09
Reviews.Content: We have just spent a long week-end in Istanbul with our 2 children (aged 12 and 10) and had a fabulous time despite awful weather thanks to this most wonderful hotel. We were lucky enough to secure one of the two 6th floor penthouse suites, which has probably one of the best views of the Golden Horn if not the best, in the whole of Istanbul. We were not let down after the initial waow factor..the hotel is a clever combination of hip but elegant luxury design without any compromises on comfort or cosiness, and is a haven of tranquillity in the midst of this bustling neighbourhood. The owner's attention to detail is faultless and the staff could not be more welcoming, helpful and smiling ..On the technical side, the beds are huge, the duvets light and warm, the bathrooms beautifully appointed and the kitchen/bar very cool, not to mention the Ipod decks and Nespresso coffee machines! The hotel serves an excellent breakfast and the fact that there is no restaurant is not a problem as there are countless coffee bars and restaurants within a few minutes' walk..It is quite a steep hill to climb from the tram stop up to the hotel, but it is well worth it for the views-and a welcome exercise after those lovely meals in town.. There are probably no views to be had from the 4th floor down-but this will remain a firm favourite for our next trip, as we cant wait to come back..

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal hotel with modern luxury, great location, amazing view!”
Reviews.Author: engine32
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Witt Istanbul Suites. We recently took a trip to Europe where we visited Istanbul, Rome, and Florence. We had a great time in all 3 cities. The hard part is that we visited Istanbul first, and the Witt Istanbul Suites set the bar so high that the other hotels were just a bit disappointing. We were in a Sea View Suite - Room 52 - with a terrific view of the Bosphorous and the historic Sultanmehmet scenery in the background. The room was very large, modern, spotless, and very stylish. Wood floor, mirrors, stainless steel finishings - very cool, like something you would expect in a boutique hotel in New York. One especially noteworthy item - the shower at the Witt is one of the best I've ever encountered in all of my worldly travels. WOW! What a great way to recharge from a long day of taking in Istanbul's sites! The only drawback to the Witt is that the hill from the tram stop is a bit steep - it does require a bit of effort to walk up/down the hill. Manageable, but something to keep in mind if you have mobility issues. The staff were all super friendly and accommodated all of our requests. The location is excellent - we loved the local neighborhood and we could get to all the sites within minutes. Additionally, the breakfast at the Witt is wonderful - the pancackes and homemade jams were delicious, and the olives with orange peel were unique and terrific! After our trip, we even received a nice email thanking us for the stay. 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Instanbul's Beyoglu and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: marilynji
Reviews.Content: A recent stay at the Witt Istanbul Suites on the north side of the Golden Horn was a perfect ending for a truly memorable visit to Turkey. The hotel has modern charm and a most wonderful staff. Helpful from the start with maps, travel books, dining recommendations, a quick smile, a refreshing lemonade drink, sweets and fruit, they insured our comfort and answered our many questions about their marvelous city. Onur, at the front desk, was foremost in providing us with information and thoughtful suggestions. All of the staff was kind, courteous, and professional. Breakfasts were delightful. The views are incomparable from the top floor. Paintings in the elevator are fun. The location of the Witt Istanbul Suites worked beautifully for us. It is below Taksim Square, a moderate walk uphill. The lively nightlife around this area, while not noisy, did make the walk back feel very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Home from home”
Reviews.Author: cp8546
Reviews.Content: The staff couldn't have been more accomodating, helpful and friendly. This was a delightful hotel and wonderful rooms. The bed was sooooo comfy and just the most prefect place for a long weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: roger31148
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for new & old Istanbul Small but excellent reception staff Large suites as expected ask for room 51 or penthouse. Downside :-Dont recommend booking city tour thru the Hotel

Reviews.Title: “This was a spectacular experience.”
Reviews.Author: Chipper42
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a vacation in Turkey and stayed at a variety of hotels. In Istanbul we stayed at a five star commercial hotel (a bit out of the way), a luxurious, five star hotel in the Sultanahmet District (wonderful if that area is all you want to see), and Witt Istanbul Suites. The hotel's location in the Beyoglu District is in the heart of the active day and night life of the vibrant city. It is within walking distance of tourist sites, the metro, and the Bosphorus ferries. The old town is no more than 20 minutes away by metro. If taxi cab rides are your thing, they are also readily available on the street in front of the hotel. The hotel is run by a young crew of exceptionally well mannered and informed gentlemen. No matter your age or travel status, they are always there to help. Ask for Hasan (espercially) or Murat or Aykut for expert help offered in english. The rooms are modern and spectacular with views of the Bosphorus to knock your socks off. If you can splurge, ask for one of the two suites on the top (6th) floor. The bathrooms are clean and very "Architectural Digest" modern. Breakfasts come with the room and are nicely presented. As an example of the service, on our last day, we were picked up at the hotel at 6:00 A.M. Hasan had arranged for the kitchen to have a breakfast prepared just for us ready at 5:00 A.M. in the lobby dining area (this is not a 24 hour room service kind of hotel). If intimate, charming, local and friendly are what you want, this is it in spades.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice of where to stay”
Reviews.Author: nanny2828
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending 8 nights at the Witt Suites. We had a fabulous trip and enjoyed the boutique hotel very much. The suites were very spacious and we were upgraded to a river view for our last 5 nights. Rates include free internet and full breakfast (including the fresh orange juice). The beds were very comfortable. The view of the river was wonderful. The hotel environment was upscale, friendly and very clean! The staff was extremely helpful and friendly...especially Onur Kara. Thanks for your help in planning our days and giving us really good suggestions regarding restaurants, transportation and fun things to do. You really helped make our stay very enjoyable and exciting.

Reviews.Title: “first time in the "new city"”
Reviews.Author: boblNashvilleTn_
Reviews.Content: My travel agent said we had to stay here, and tell her if it was as good as advertised.It is, and probably better. We stayed just one night on the way back home from a great vacation, and it was off season (the rates lower after Oct. 1st). I must say though I would probably stay here anytime. We have been in Istanbul several times, but this was our first stay in the new city. Don't miss this part of the city, and this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: reenalindorff
Reviews.Content: Location, service, food, rooms par excellence!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel of Our Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: TheWinokurs
Reviews.Content: Istanbul was our second stop on a 4-stop honeymoon and the Witt was by far the nicest hotel that we stayed in. When we arrived, we were upgraded to the penthouse suite and given a bottle of wine because it was our honeymoon. What a great surprise! The room was absolutely gorgeous. We loved the modern decor, the spacious room, and the amazing view from the balcony. The bathroom was so luxurious, the Molton Brown products were great and the rain shower couldn't be beat! We were so thrilled by the staff as well. They were so courteous and friendly and helped us navigate through Istanbul with ease. One of our favorite amenities of our stay at the Witt was the breakfast. It was absolutely delicious and the best hotel breakfast of all of the hotels on our honeymoon! (We highly recommend the lemon-peel stuffed olives!) The best part about their breakfast is that you can have it delivered to your room so that you can enjoy the view or have it in the lobby so that you can make friends with other guests. We loved this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “We considered staying in the room all day and taking turns showering.”
Reviews.Author: KarenLongIsland
Reviews.Content: Istanbul was great outside -- but the room tempted us to stay in. The shower was my favorite anywhere. The room was huge, the bed comfortable, the breakfast delicious, the staff gracious and charming. NOTE: The hotel provides online directions prior and maps once you get there. USE THEM for taxi drivers. Due to one way streets, this hotel is difficult for taxi drivers to find. It's also an easy walk down to the tram leaving, but returning to the hotel it is a climb, so be warned. The hotel is away from the tourist area, but transportation is relatively inexpensive and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: sray1
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Great room with amazing view. Warm and welcoming staff. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: jump3r
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights. The room is very big and it has a small kitchen and living room. Kinda like a studio type. Very nice, very modern design. And of course very clean. The breakfast is okay. Simple. I am not a breakfast person, so i dont mind. Location is very close to taksim square. We would just walked if we wanted to go there. There are plenty of cafe and restaurants nearby too. If you want to go to old town, then you have to take a tram or taxi. But it s also gonna be a quick ride. Would i stay here again? yes. Unless i want to have a room that i can with a view. (they might have a room with view, but we didnt get it so we cant judge how good the view is..but i dont think the view is gonna be that good coz there are lots of building blocking the view)

Reviews.Title: “perfect boutique hotel, good location, excellent and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: cineteach
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Witt on Sept. 4h at 2:00am. The receptionist greeted us warmly and had our bags taken to our room within 5 minutes. Fresh fruit and bottled water was waiting for us in the room. Everything that has written about these rooms is true. This hotel is truly a find in a big bustling city. We were in room 52 and the view of the Bosphorous was delightful. the room is like a very large studio and we were very comfortable there. The staff goes out of their way to be helpful in any way they can. I noticed on past reviews there were complaints about a lack of magnifying mirrors in the bathroom. They have now been installed. Someone also mentioned the lack of tissue boxes in the bathrooms. They have also been added.There have also been past complaints about a charge for fresh orange juice and now the juice is free of charge with a delicious complimentary breakfast. We mentioned that it would be helpful to have an alarm clock next to the bed and they made note of that and had already taken up the issue with the owners. I am sure future guests will find alarm clocks in the rooms. The staff at this hotel goes out of their way to accomodate their guests with any questions they may have. We asked for suggestions for restaurants and both Murat and Onur were very helpful. I even asked about a place to have a Turkish bath and Murat gave us the name of a local place that he and his friends use. I don't know what I was expecting, but it is honesly, an experience both my husband and I will never forget. (quite unlike your normal massages in the USA). As mentioned, the hotel is on a hill and it is pretty steep walk up several blocks to the Taxim Square at the top. We kept our thoughts positive and decided it was simply good exercise, but be prepared for the hike up the hill. If we ever go back to Istanbul, we would not hesitate in booking another stay at this lovely boutique hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: Deltavijf
Reviews.Content: We, five doctors, spent five nights at this wonderful hotel. The suites are spacious and the design is stunning. The staff is very friendly and couldnâ€™t be more helpful. The cleaning is immaculate, the location is perfect. Most important however is the very relaxed, welcoming, stylish and friendly atmosphere. To tell the truth we wanted to keep the secret to ourselves but that would have been a crime against humanity so here we go: We highly recommend this hotel en will not hesitate to book again when we are in Istanbul in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Great Part of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: MattR_Chicago
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 6 terrific days at the Witt Istanbul in September. The hotel offers great rooms that are incredibly spacious and include great ammenities, all in a great location in the fantastic city of Istanbul. The hotel rooms are very large, offering a separate sitting area and a small kitchenette with a microwave and small refrigerator and a sink and comes with dishes and utensils for use. The room also includes a fantastic bathroom that includes a fantastic and enormous rain shower. The Witt offers a free breakfast which is pretty good, offering a good selection of breads and jams and cheeses. The location, while on a very steep hill, is an ideal location for exploring Istanbul. It is across the Golden Horn from the major tourist sights in Sultahanmet and as a result is in a real neighborhood. The street the hotel is on is lined with restaurants, bakeries, and cafes primarily frequented by locals and not tourists. While the hotel is up a steep hill from the nearest tram stop, it is a walkable hill. And there are alternatives to get up the hill, such as the two nearby funiculars. The hotel is located near Taksim Square and Istikal Cadessi, offering lots of restaurants and shopping opportunities. While it is across the Galata Bridge from the major sights of Sultanahmet, it is only about a 45 minute walk to those sights, or a quick tram ride. The hotel is also close - about a 10 minute walk - from the metro stop in Taksim Square. Personally, I liked being a bit away from the major tourist attractions and in a neighborhood. The hotel staff were incredibly nice and helpful at all times. Next time I make it back to Istanbul I will definitely stay at the Witt.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary with all the amenities”
Reviews.Author: Denndy
Reviews.Content: Spent a lovely 2 nights before our cruise. Enjoyed being in Beyoglu, with a tram making Sultanahmet and its blockbuster sights a 15 minute trip. It was quiet in the evenings and convenient to the main walking street for restaurants and nightlife. The only issue we had was the walk uphill from the tram station was quite steep if only 2-3 blocks. Everyone at the hotel was great. Very helpful with directions and recommendations. The suite was large and comfortable, and we enjoyed the change of pace of ultramodern fixtures and decor.

Reviews.Title: “Bliss - sheer heaven”
Reviews.Author: lisaberlin
Reviews.Content: We had a dreadful trip getting to Istanbul with our airline going out of business and not notifying us. However on arrival at Witt Suites, Istanbul we were greeted warmly and made to feel utterly relaxed and pampered. Tuncel and Secil, brother and sister owners were wonderful assisted by their great team and we were upgraded to their wonderful penthouse suite with breathtaking views over the Bospherous. We had breakfast served there and the staff were marvellous, accommodating in every way and we felt like we were their number 1 priority! The suite was a marriage of chic state of the art style and true comfort with a tranquil ambience. Every little detail had been considered to make your stay as perfect as possible. The design was a feast for the eyes. The breakfast was varied, generous, healthy, delicious and well balanced. Something different appeared everyday and the homemade grissini sticks in the lobby and homemade chocolate muffins that appeared everyday in our suite were delicously wicked! Tuncel and Secil gave great insider tips on arrival so we did not have to spend our short stay finding things out. We went to neighbourhoods we would never have found thanks to them and enjoyed the most we possibly could from our 5 day stay. The restaurants they booked and recommended were spot on and varied. Their staff could not do enough for us and helped in every small way. Secil even made us a little map of a particular neighbourhood with her favourite shops because we wanted to shop and take advantage of the sales. She was great and we are so very grateful. The hotel is set on a hill with outstanding views of the Bospherous and landmarks of Istanbul in an area full of life with lots of coffee shops and great ecclectic boutiques. You are walking distance from Taksim and this could not have been a more perfect trip. In fact we are definitely going back in January as it was so memorable and we are still talking about it. Thankyou to Tuncel, Secil and their wonderful team for making this trip Bliss - and creating sheer heaven inside the walls of Witt Suites - a contrast to the hectic busy city of Istanbul. We cannot recommend this hotel enough - fantastic value and outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous site, fabulous staff - a jewel as sparkling as those seen in Tokapi Palace”
Reviews.Author: Dixie_in_UK
Reviews.Content: I booked at the Witt in June for an international conference to be held in Sept based on Trip Advisor reviews. (The official conference hotels were all nondescript , large chains and because I only had limited time to explore Istanbul outside of my meetings, I was looking for something smaller and more personalised.) Beginning with my initial emails to the hotel, I was impressed with their prompt and thorough communications. In addition, their website includes a wealth of information (including videos!) about the area and provides helpful tools (e.g., maps, print instructions in English/Turkish to help the taxi drivers find the hotel) for organizing your journey. Upon arrival, I was so pleased that my initial positive experiences continued throughout the stay. The staff at Witt - especially Murat at reception and Kursad in the cafe area - were extremely patient with questions (eg, directions, recommendations, pronunciation of names, etc.). Starting with the refreshing lemonade at check-in, everyone went out of their way to be helpful and they welcomed you to call them at any time if you received confusing information outside the hotel. The hotel is located in a truly lovely neighborhood - on a small street lined with local cafes and shops. If you walk 5 mins south (down the steeper - but not actually too steep - of the hills described in other reviews), you are at the Tophane tram stop (a great and inexpensive way to avoid the taxi issues described in previous discussions on Istanbul) and just a few more mins to the water. To get to the Lutfi Kirdar Convention Center (LKCC - the site of my meeting) was a very nice 22 min walk north; of which about 12 mins is a gentle hill (definitely NOT steep - I walked it twice daily for 7 days in shoes with 2.5" heels with no problem). To get to the LKCC, you pass through Taksim Square and just adjacent to the Istiklal pedestrian avenue so you have very easy access to all the restaurants, shopping and entertainment you could ever want. You are also quite close to the best baklava and Turkish sweets in the world... at the Karakoy Gulluoglu (don't miss it!). The rooms are quite large by European standards and 2 adults had plenty of room to coexist comfortably. Everything is very clean, sleek and purposeful. After a long, steamy day it's a nice place to relax... and the showers are especially refreshing. My room was fully equipped (microwave, TV, refrigerator, kettle, iPod dock, Nespresso machine, etc) and everything worked very well. When we requested an iron/board to press clothes for the conference, one was provided within 5 minutes. The complimentary breakfast buffet is delicious - a nice combination of fruits, grains, coffee/tea and fresh juice. In contrast to a previous review, I actually enjoyed eating in the well purposed reception... very chic, reminding me of the Library Hotel in New York City. High speed wireless is complimentary (some of my colleagues were paying 20E/day at the big chains) and there is also a computer in the lounge that you can use. The Witt reception area has a book of restaurants (all kinds) that they personally recommend and they offered great advice about seeing the local sites. I was fortunate to have a week of gorgeous weather with rain (and sadly floods in the NW) coming only on the last day - on which I was offered an umbrella by reception. In conclusion, I will definitely be returning (for pleasure!) to Istanbul and I will absolutely book the Witt Istanbul Suites. Witt and it's very kind staff provided an excellent first visit to this beautiful city and I can't imagine that I could find as positive experience for the very reasonable price at any other place.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: jclsm
Reviews.Content: Very great hotel, Great suites. Very good service. Excellent value for money. Only to be improved: Fresh juice fruit in breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “crap”
Reviews.Author: goddess115
Reviews.Content: This hotel did not live up to its reputation.The rooms had inadequate lighting,the decor awful,and there was no dining room/breakfast room.We had to eat in the reception area with inadequate room for tables and chairs.The kettle in the room didnt work,and there was no microwave provided as stated in the brocure.It was advertised as being five minutes from the main tram system.This was not correct.It was about 20 minutes away down a very steep hill! The brocure said there would be a hottub on the roof,there wasnt!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: AndyHampshire
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Witt Istanbul. Hotel is in a convenient location. The rooms are amazing. The hotel staff couldn't have been more helpful - They recommended perfect restaurants to suit our needs, printed off maps & bus time tables to help us find various place. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dekangaroo
Reviews.Content: My wife picked this hotel after seeing it in Travel & Leisure magazine. It is centrally located and extremely good value compared to the large chain hotels. All of the 17 rooms are suites of around 800sq ft. The service and rooms were outstanding. The only drawback is it is located on the side of a hill which is quite a climb. Well located next to the tram line and only two stops from the Blue Mosque and Spice Bazaar.

Reviews.Title: “The classiest hotel I've ever stayed at in the world”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter00754
Reviews.Content: Quite simply the classiest, best maintained, cleanest, and best staffed hotel I've stayed at anywhere (and I travel frequently). I had read the reviews online, so my expectations were high. The staff set up a private boat trip along the Bosphorus so I could propose to my girlfriend - they bent over backwards to help me with this at no extra charge. The regular room we stayed in was larger and better furnished than the (smaller of the few) top-floor penthouse suites we moved to on our last night. The balcony of the penthouse suite and its view of the Bosphorus are stunning, however, despite the room's smaller layout. The regular suites are probably a better value in the end. The (all male) staff was exceedingly kind and helpful in giving us info on places to walk, eat, and go out to. The reviewers who complain of the hotel's location on a steep, inclined street need to get a life, or get some (mild) exercise. Seriously, the hotel's location on a hilly street, very close to a very hip neighborhood, is the last thing I would detract from this establishment. When eaten in the ground floor common breakfast area, the complimentary morning breakfast is hearty and delicious. The room service version of the breakfast (also free) is skimpy and leaves you wanting more food. Internet is free and connection is good. In summary, this is a hotel to write home about, tell your friends about (I certainly did), and write a fitting TripAdvisor report on. Perfect for business, romance, getaway, honeymoon, etc.

Reviews.Title: “We liked the location and service so much we extended our stay!”
Reviews.Author: tygr_tygr
Reviews.Content: Even before we arrived, the Witt staff were lining up restaurants and advice for us. When we arrived they blew us away arranging concert tickets, shopping advice, restaurant reservations - even late night milk and cookies! The Witt enjoys an outstanding location. It is within 500m of the main pedestrian mall, the outstanding Istanbul Modern museum and probably 7 of the top 10 restaurants in Istanbul. The Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque are a 200m walk plus 10 minute tram ride away (trams are modern, air conditioned and only $1 for as long as you ride!). It also has fantastic staff. Every member of the Witt team was friendly, and responsive. The main interactions are all with the Reception leaders who speak excellent English and are available 24 hours a day. They were all full of excellent advice for making the most of the stay in Istanbul - not just about booking tours, but also recommending Istanbul hidden gems (the local hammam, manicure and pedicure). The non-english speaking staff were also universally friendly and helpful. The Witt is also an extremely modern and comfortable design hotel. Our room was large and fitted with beautifully designed furniture, an iPod dock, flat screen TV and an amazing 7 piece waterfall shower head. We enjoyed the Witt so much that we changed the rest of our Turkey plans to stay just a little longer with the Witt and with Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “We need to go back!”
Reviews.Author: rishidalal
Reviews.Content: Possibly one of the best hotels we have stayed at... at least in this price range. A fun, funky, young, very very spacious, and very hospitable place... even in a city like Istanbul we felt like spending time in the hotel... a home away from home for our 5 nights. It all started with a very warm check-in experience in a pretty funky lobby. When we got to our room, we were pleasantly surprised at how big it was. The bathroom was impressive, with an unbelievable shower. Great amenities, a large flat-screen TV, comfortable bed. The breakfast was great... amazing quality ingredients. All the staff was very friendly, always helpful and jovial. A must stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: loudo16
Reviews.Content: Simply put, this is the best hotel I ever stayed in. Some of the things I really liked: - SERVICE. The staff had great recommendations for the rest of our trip (cop sis in Selcuk and the boat tour in Fethiye) - ROOM. The room did not looked like an hotel room, more like an ultra design mini apartment. Great attention to details all around. The ipod speaker is a great addition. - BATHROOM. The ceiling multi jets shower was awesome although it makes it harder if you don't want to wet your hair :) The biggest towels I ever seen! - BREAKFAST. Compared to other reviews, I found the breakfast to be exquisite. Hands down, the best olives I tasted in Turkey. Products are fresh and refined. Brewed coffee is free but you need to pay for expresso, cappucino (those little capsule) & fresh orange juice. BTW, it is clearly written on a board in the breakfast area - LOCATION. The Beyoglu area is much better at night (eating and drinking) than in Sultanahmet. Located in a quiet spot close to everything. Convenient tram station - 5 minutes walk. Unfortunately, we didn't stay there when we got back to Istanbul, cause it's fairly expensive but totally worth it if you want to splurge. Quick tips: - make sure you get the direction (in Turkish) from the hotel for your taxi cab from the airport, ours got lost... - the restaurant & bars they recommend in Istanbul is pretty much all the high end stuff... so be careful if you're on a tight budget. - ask for a wake up call on your first night if you're coming from north america... with the nice bed & jet lag... we totally missed breakfast on our first morning (something you don't want to do!)

Reviews.Title: “Did not disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: todaywewent
Reviews.Content: We just had a chance to spend a night in the Witt and wish we could have stayed longer! Wow! It absolutely lived up to all of the positive reviews it's already received. Our room (a city view suite) was amazing... beautiful kitchen area, balcony, living area, and amazingly comfortable bed. We felt immediately as though we'd walked into a gorgeous apartment. Not to mention the bathroom and it's shower - the best I have EVER come across in a hotel! The staff was top of the line and incredibly helpful in arranging our transportation to and from the hotel as well as directing us towards where to go for a late night dinner in Istanbul once we'd arrived. The location itself was great but would definitely recommend getting a taxi/pickup when you arrive with your luggage - the hill would be a little intense otherwise. We were so happy with this hotel and so happy we chose it. We definitely hope to return one day and would definitely recommend to anyone traveling to Istanbul!
