Reviews.Title: “Wish we were back there now”
Reviews.Author: scory
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday from the Witt and can't wait to go back next year. I am an Architect and really appreciated our beautifully designed suite with all of its thought-out touches. The rooms are large with chic kitchenettes and a comfortable seating area. The beds and soft duvets are heavenly. The windows cut out all street noise and I didn't notice anynoise from other rooms. I had been looking all over town for Cornucopia magazine, but only found it here with our well-edited coffee table magazines. My only suggestion would be for adding lighted make-up mirrors in the bathrooms, as the overhead light makes it difficult to see well in there. Lighting is great in other areas. Otherwise, I found the hotel to be absolutely perfect. It is not a fancy Palace-type hotel and not so self-consciously cool that you feel intimidated (we had stayed at the W Istanbul earlier). We loved the location. The trams are particularly simple to navigate--even from the airport. Just make sure that you take a taxi up that hill with your luggage. It's not too far, but those few blocks are tough with rolling luggage. Otherwise, we found the Witt to be an easy walk from restaurants and sights (w/ the old city reachable by tram). There's a great non-touristy cafe 5-6 blocks up Defterdar Yokusa on your left, and we loved the rooftop restaurant, 5 Kat, a few blocks away. This neighborhood feels like the Village or Soho in NYC. I just wanted to thank the staff at the Witt. They were friendly and caring. Hasan, particularly, made us feel well taken care of by bringing us coffee before our early morning check-out and by responding to my e-mails with such warmth. Also, the reception desk fellow on Monday night was a fount of information and help. Sorry, I forget his name. This hotel deserves its kudos! We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “world class contemporary designed boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: retiredprof17
Reviews.Content: We spent the last four days of our Turkey vacation in this boutique property in Cihanger after reading all the recent glowing reviews in US travel magazines. They did not prepare us for how stunning this suite hotel is. Every room detail is spectacular, even better than their website photos. We were in sea view suite 52, with panoramic views over the Bosphorus and the sights of the historic district. It was stunning. This is from someone who has had sea view rooms on the Riviera and in Positano. The location is very good for experiencing the real Istanbul, but not as great for seeing the sights in Sultanahmet. We found the front desk staff, Murat, Aykut, and Onur to be very helpful and thoughtful. We thought the amenities to be world class, e.g., Molton Brown, and the breakfast spread to be very good. There were a few minor services glitches, not unreasonable for a new hotel. Overall, you will look long and hard to find a property like this in a major tourist location for under $250 anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “The best place - The best staff”
Reviews.Author: BillyBene
Reviews.Content: We've been to Istanbul for the F1 Grand Prix and we had a wonderfull time there thanks to this hotel and mostly the staff that makes you feel tha you are into the best travel agency and takes care for everything as if you were their best friend. You don't have to worry about anything because the guys there will recommend you the best places to go, will make the right suggestions, reservations at the right times in places you won't fing in any traveller guide or site. You will never feel as tourist and you will find people who concern about you as they were your best friend smilling and ready to fix anything for you. The suites are fantastic with great interior - design, fantastic lighting - design and you feel like you have already rent a loft in New York that is fully equiped with anything you need. It is even equiped with espresso machine and i-pod loud speakers !!! The whole building has a lounge atmosphere with the appropriate music and you think that everything is set to right place. It is also located in a neighbourhood that is has a classy feeling and you feel the culture differences to many other places in the town and you will never feel as you were in a touristic area. It is close to many nice European style restaurants - bar - cafe - bistrots and by a short walking you can be in the heart of modern Istanbul. The only thing I would make some changes is the breakfast that seems some kind of "poor" and I also did not like the fact you could eat anything at breakfast but you had to pay for the orange juice. I can tell you for sure tha this makes a black spot in a perfect environment. I know that they will fix this because I'm sure the guys are perfectionists!! Once again I have to thank and congratulate all the staff that made us feel between friends and with their care and their recommendations made our trip one of the best we had. I hope you'll create Wiit suites in other European cities also under the same philosophy and when you do please let me know immediatelly!!!

Reviews.Title: “This has to be THE place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Curley44
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a great place. Everything was spot on from the service to the wonderful suite. Even the location is great. Yes, itâ€™s about a 30 minute walk to the â€œsightsâ€� of Istanbul but, the area around Witt Istanbul is buzzing. There are bars and restaurants galore and also the main shopping area in Istanbul, including some wonderful antique shops. Also, the walk to see the traditional sights over the Galata Bridge gives you a chance to see another side to Istanbul - and you can always catch the tram. Our suite didnâ€™t technically have a view but, if you hung out of the small Juliette balcony you could see the Bosphorus which was enough of a view for us. The decor of the suite was so contemporary and there was so much room with a huge bed, sitting area and a gorgeous bathroom with amazing shower. You really couldnâ€™t ask for anything more. On our first night they even ordered pizza for us to eat in our room. The breakfast buffet each morning was really delicious and served by friendly staff. On one night we ate at Changa just down the road which was wonderful whilst the views from Leb-i-Derya at the Richmond Hotel where we had drinks are just stunning. The hotel sorted out a trip to the Aga hamman for me and my husband. Being a prudish Brit amongst a room of me (as well as male masseuses) it was certainly an experience. I was very kindly taken to a separate room for my massage but, do expect to expose yourself to the masseuse! Well, whilst in Turkey!

Reviews.Title: “what a view”
Reviews.Author: warwickrose
Reviews.Content: My husband,myself, daughter +grandaughter have recently returned from a holiday in Turkey,staying 4 nights at Istanbul Suites.The hotel was extremely modern,clean,with friendly staff.We wish that we had been warned about the very steep hill,which one had to negotiate to either reach the tram stop,or walk to the Galata Bridge.My husband +I are both retired but very active,even so found it too much.We resolved to taxis a few times,but found the hotel was'nt known to them,resulting in us directing the driver to the best of our ability.The breakfasts were very limited with choice,you kneeded to know beforehand you can actually have `eggs' if you ask for them,+ to our horror you had to pay extra for fresh juice.Needless to say bottled water was 10times the price of elswhere .How much would it cost them to supply 2small complimentary bottles a day.On the plus side the views from our rooms were fantastic,especially at night.It's a small hotel in a residential area,with a few good restaurants within reasonable walking distance,but we found it rather too far out from the main tourist sights etc.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable, extreme value for the buck”
Reviews.Author: Erzeman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at witt a couple of nights in late may 2009 with my girlfriend and was astonished, good location, great service, sure, but to get a suite that sixe for that amount of money in a modern, neatly designed and detail-perfected hotel is almost to good to be true. kept looking for hooks, but there simply were none. or, perhaps a rooftop pool would have perfected the whole but at that time it wasn't that hot in istanbul anyway. and design-wise i felt right at home, in sweden, with its modern take on scandinavian cool. just go!

Reviews.Title: “Just go!”
Reviews.Author: Travelswithasuitcase
Reviews.Content: The reviews are all correct. The hotel is a triumph of design whilst still being very comfortable. Good quality bedding. Excellent breakfasts. Lots of space even on the lower floors. But it is the staff who make staying here such a pleasure. From the surprise Mother's Day gift (thank you) through to recommendations for trips out and food the staff are friendly and very helpful. Even when our transfer to the airport failed to turn up (more about the transfer company in Istanbul forum) the staff moved swiftly to organise a transfer for us which despite exceptionally heavy traffic jams managed to get us to the airport on time. They even telephoned us during the trip to the airport to keep us informed of the estimated time of arrival as the driver did not speak English! Now that is thoughtful! My only suggestion is that breakfast needs some explanation. Fresh fruit juice and cooked eggs are available if you ask but they cost extra which isn't made clear. It would have been nice to know that freshly squeezed orange was available on day one. If you do not want to be closeted in the centre of Istanbul with the carpet sellers and hordes of tourists then stay in Beyoglu which is the European area of the city. The area is lovely with lots of places to eat and drink. You can spend ages exploring the back streets and mixing with the locals. As I have mobility problems we didn't climb up the hill from Tophane Tram station. We took the tram to Kabatas (next stop along from Tophane) and then the funicular to Taksim Square where we then strolled down to the hotel with lots of opportunity for shopping on the way especially at the cake shop !! Simples!

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing!”
Reviews.Author: jammyh
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Witt. From the minute we arrived, we were completely spoilt. The check-in was easy and the guys behind the desk could not do enough to help and recommend places to visit or eat/drink. We had a room on the 4th floor (43) and I would totally recommend the extra cost to get the larger room AND the view of the old town. The rooms are absolutely beautiful. Everything from the attention to detail in the wall hangings, through to the excellent little kitchen/bar areas is just a dream. Our room was also huge, which meant that a late afternoon rest on the divine leather sofa with a chilled bottle of wine, some baklava and a DVD from the collection downstairs, was a real treat after a full day of sightseeing! Yes, the hotel is half way up a fairly steep hill, but taxis are cheap and if you canâ€™t face the walk, they are an easy way to get home. We didnâ€™t bother and revelled in the fact that everything was within easy walking distance. I canâ€™t think of one negative thing to say about the Witt and am almost annoyed that my gushing may make this place less of a secret! That said, I hope that anyone looking for a room in Istanbul takes the advice and books a room at the Witt as quickly as they can.

Reviews.Title: “perfect mix of casual, professional & welcoming”
Reviews.Author: luckygirlLondon
Reviews.Content: the rooms at the witt are beautifully designed, they are the perfect start to a memorable trip. they also present good value for money. the location is perfect in that it is a short (15 min) walk to the galetta bridge or a very convenient short tram ride to all the major sights in the sultahamet. the hotel is on a short but steep section of the road, which was fine for us, but may pose a problem for others, but then a lot of istanbul has short sections of hill to navigate. nothing a child couldnt cope with. the staff at the hotel are fantastic, really friendly and welcoming, one even offered to meet us after work to take us to a club he thought we might not find by ourselves (his map worked perfectly). the breakfasts were to die for, home-made jams and cakes mega-fresh!

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel anywhere”
Reviews.Author: jzsf
Reviews.Content: Just an amazing hotel. Great staff. Huge, comfortable, stylish rooms. One of the most comfortable hotel beds I've slept in (and I sleep in a lot of hotel beds). Fantastic bathroom, great location, and very good breakfast buffet in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “some small details”
Reviews.Author: Repko
Reviews.Content: Rightly so! The number 1 of Istanbul. But because everybody is so overwhelmingly positive, a few remarks. There is no bath, yes the most amazing shower ever seen (Istanbul range of VitrA, by Ross Lovegrove and Molton Brown lotions) but no bath. It was hot during the night, we asked if the airco could be set on, but they said it was only a heater, not an airco. Probably mistaking. The staff is, by the way, perfect. They will help you with every detail, bookings etc. The location: you must be a pretty good walker, because the streets up there are quite hilly. The streetcar is close by.

Reviews.Title: “Uber super!”
Reviews.Author: smsrock
Reviews.Content: All the previous reviews are to be believed. Prime location in Beyoglu. And while on a slope, this is not a disadvantage because if you walk downhill you're at Tophane tram station, which is crucial for seeing the sites. And if you choose to go uphill you find yourself at Taksim square very quickly. Aykut has to the best hotel receptionist/concierge that we have ever come across in our travels (even though he's a Galatasaray supporter! LOL). He was very knowledgeable and offered great tips on the sights, sounds and tastes of the city...just ask him! The rest of the staff was very pleasant and friendly as well. As for the room, extremely comfortable, a home away from home! And the shower has to be even better than home! Would definitely stay here again next time we return.

Reviews.Title: “felt like home-excellent service”
Reviews.Author: georgemarino
Reviews.Content: Rooms and feeling of the whole place?Out of the six night stay at Witt,my friend woke up one day feeling ill and as a result we had to stay in most of the day - neither my friend nor I felt like being locked up in a hotel room.We actually enjoyed the well designed spacious suites with all comforts provided like an espresso machine - dvd e.t.c.The staff were all helpful and always with a smile, from the boys at breakfast to the driver who picked us at the airport to Murat and Aykut who were always willing to help out and arranged our restaurant reservations by even attatching guides and maps to our e-mails prior to our arrival. Not to forget - the shower is just great! Will visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Beware: you will be disappointed with your next hotel”
Reviews.Author: My-View-on-things
Reviews.Content: If you want to know how cool this place is, listen to its website background music (can anyone tell me who is playing that big fat baritone sax?). When we entered the room, all we could think was 'damn, how are we going to surpass this on a future city trip..'. Spoilt rotten at Witt Istanbul. Only after thinking very hard I can come up with a suggestion: raise the rates just enough to make orange juice included at breakfast (it felt a bit silly to pay for it seperately).

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service and Value”
Reviews.Author: Gosforth_Ultra
Reviews.Content: Echo what everyone else has said - this really is a fantastic hotel run by great people. My wife and I brought my parents here as a treat for their 60th birthdays and all four of us were in agreement that everything about Witt was special. Firstly, the area it is in, Cihangir is superb - fairly central and with some lovely cafes and bars (plus a massive hill to the hotel to work those calories off!). In terms of the hotel itself - really superb value in a city that actually isn't that cheap. We've stayed in similar hotels at three times the price and as well as the rooms being very spacious and tastefully decorated, the breakfasts are great and the service first class. The staff (Murat especially!) went out of their way to make us feel at home and I guess that is what really sets the place apart - very friendly, very helpful. All in all an unforgettable trip to a magical city, totally enhanced by Witt. Oh, and Galatasaray have got two new fans based in Newcastle! Great stuff.

HotelInfo.Name: Witt Istanbul Suites
HotelInfo.Address: Defterdar Yokusu No. 26 | Cihanger, Beyoglu, Istanbul 34433, Turkey
